characters: AT THE SIDE OF THE FORT
AT THE STOP OF THE STEPS
A SET OF CURTAINS TO THE COCKPIT
AT THE SIDE OF THE BUILDING
AT THE BASE OF THE HILL
ON THE GROUNDS OF FORT KNOX
THE PORCH OF THE PLANTATION HOUSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a VERY LONG SHOT, TWO GUARDS patrol past enormous oil storage tanks. PULL BACK to reveal an outer rock wall. It obscures the men. CRANE DOWN to reveal a harbour. A seagu swims by in f.g.

dialogues.speaker: THE SEAGULL
dialogues.text: rises out of the water revealing Bond in a black diving s The seagull is a decoy atop his head. Bond grips the bott rung of a ladder.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: tears his headgear off and tosses it behind him. It lands the water.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE QUAY
dialogues.text: Bond, wearing a backpack, walks to the wall and points a pistol at its top. He fires the pistol. A rope flies over the top of the wal

dialogues.speaker: A GUARD
dialogues.text: hears a cracking sound and looks back.

dialogues.speaker: A GRAPPLING HOOK
dialogues.text: at the end of the rope snags the inside of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARD
dialogues.text: walks forward, feeling for his gun. Suddenly Bond jumps o him from above. TILT DOWN as they fall. Bond rises and, a the guard attempts to rise, Bond kicks him in the face. T guard falls onto his back.  2. Bond jumps over his supine body and runs toward the stora tanks.

dialogues.speaker: THE STORAGE TANKS
dialogues.text: The other guard walks away between two of the tanks. The moment he leaves view, Bond runs to one of them. He stops kneels at a cover.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: feels behind the cover. A door in the side of the tank sw open. Bond rises quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond enters, closes the door behind him and turns on the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are poppy pods in f.g., a desk and numerous boxes. DOLLY BACK and PAN on Bond as he moves to the centre of t room.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLY IN as Bond takes off a plastic tubular belt and wal three drums in f.g. labeled "NITRO." He holds the belt ov the first drum.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST DRUM
dialogues.text: Bond squeezes a white jelly from the belt onto the drum. moves to the next drum. He squirts more jelly onto it. Th he takes off his backpack, sets it on a drum, opens it an takes out a timer with wires leading to a primer.

dialogues.speaker: THE TIMER
dialogues.text: Bond pivots his wrist to check his watch, which reads 12: then sets the timer to 12:20. It ticks loudly. Bond looks down.

dialogues.speaker: ONE OF THE TANKS
dialogues.text: He presses the primer into the jelly on the drum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN on Bond as he runs to the door, turns off the lights, slips outside and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: THE TIMER
dialogues.text: between two drums ticks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond jumps down different levels from the top of the wall the ground. He pulls off his diving suit to reveal him wearing a whit tuxedo and black bow-tie. He takes a red carnation from h back pocket, puts it in his lapel and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONITA dances amidst a crowd at tables.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: enters, passes hanging wicker baskets, takes out a cigare case and removes a cigarette. He looks down.

dialogues.speaker: BONITA
dialogues.text: shimmies at a customer then looks up, noticing Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: lights a cigarette lighter and holds it up to his watch.

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S WATCH
dialogues.text: It reads 12:19.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: lowers his wrist and lights his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The timer hits 12:20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge explosion occurs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fireball extends over the rock wall.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CANTINA
dialogues.text: Bond casually lights his cigarette as the explosion conti glasses crash and the crowd jumps up and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond walks down some steps as people run past him toward entrance.

dialogues.speaker: BONITA
dialogues.text: She kneels without an audience as people run away.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: DOLLY BACK as Bond approaches the bar past fleeing custom A man in a gray suit sits at the bar -- SIERRA.

dialogues.speaker: SIERRA
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: SIERRA
dialogues.text: Mister Ramirez and his friends will be out of business.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: At least they won't be using heroin-flavoured bananas to finance revolutions. He looks off.

dialogues.speaker: BONITA
dialogues.text: angrily exits into her dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: SIERRA
dialogues.text: Don't go back to your hotel, sefior. They'1l be watching you. Bond takes a key from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a plane leaving for Miami in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: ON BOND
dialogues.text: He fingers the key.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'll be on it. But, uh, first I have some unfinished business to attend to. (he looks at the key)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scrubs herself in a tub. She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Bond enters shutting the door behind him. He tosses the k aside, takes a towel from a hook and throws it off to Bon We hear water plop. Bond removes his jacket, revealing a shoulder holster and gun. He hangs the jacket on a hook.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bonita, naked but holding the towel against herself, goes Bond. He hugs her and they kiss. Suddenly she backs up.

dialogues.speaker: BONITA
dialogues.text: oh!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (touching his gun) Forgive me. He walks to a hook on the wall removing his holster.

dialogues.speaker: BONITA
dialogues.text: Why do you always wear that thing?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (hanging his holster on the hook) I have a slight inferiority complex. (he turns to her) Where was I? -- Oh, yes.  TRACK IN SLIGHTLY as he embraces her.

dialogues.speaker: THEM
dialogues.text: As Bond kisses her, an assailant -- CAPUNGO -- approaches behind a wardrobe in b.g., brandishing a cosh.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING BONITA
dialogues.text: She opens her eyes and looks at him over Bond's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CAPUNGO
dialogues.text: approaches raising the cosh.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING BOND
dialogues.text: He leans back from Bonita looking into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BONITA'S LEFT EYE
dialogues.text: The pupil reflects Capungo approaching with the raised co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond suddenly swings Bonita around. Capungo smashes her o the head.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - As she drops, Bond grabs Capungo's raised arm and bring down. - Bond knees Capungo under the chin. He flies backwards. - Capungo bounces off a settee, grabs a chair and smashes against Bond's back, throwing him forwards. - Bond falls backwards against the wardrobe. Capungo punc him in the jaw, sending him sideways to the door, then pu him twice in the stomach. Bond groans. Capungo readies another punch. Bond suddenly pulls him forward. - Bond throws Capungo over his back. - Capungo lands on his back on the floor, then swivels to up. - Bond lunges at him. - Capungo, arms braced against a table behind him, tries kick Bond. Bond grabs his leg and twists it. Capungo lays hand across Bond's face, pushing him back.  - CLOSER: Capungo keeps pushing. Bond grabs his arm. - Bond hurls him backwards. - Capungo falls on his back into the tub, arms flailing. - Bond, almost grinning, looks at him ready to strike aga - Capungo reaches for Bond's gun in the hanging holster. - His hand gropes for it. - Bond looks on in alarm. - Capungo aims the gun at Bond. - Bond slaps a small electric fan toward the tub. - The fan lands in the tub at Capungo's feet, lighting th water red and sending sparks flying. - Capungo's legs, glowing red, fly into the air as he is electrocuted. - Bond looks on as a sizzling sound occurs off-screen.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: PAN on him as he walks through smoke to the tub, takes hi gun, puts it in his holster, takes his holster from the h and puts it on.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Shocking. He walks to his jacket, reaches for it, then hears a fema groan and looks back.

dialogues.speaker: BONITA
dialogues.text: is on the floor trying to raise herself.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: as we see Bonita and Capungo's upturned feet in f.g.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Positively shocking. He puts on his coat and goes out the door, closing it sha behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images of Bond's exploits are projected on a voluptuous, bikini-clad lady as superimposed titles appear. Titles en black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A banner flies by that says "WELCOME TO MIAMI BEACH."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The banner trails a small plane flying over a strip of Mi Beach hotels. A blimp sails by in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: We move in on the hotel then swing behind it and move in the high dive of a swimming pool. A MAN jumps off the hig dive, doing a series of somersaults.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man splashes into the water, then a GIRL swims by. PA OVER to reveal we're looking through a window on the pool along with FELIX LEITER in a business suit. He grins and moves on past a roller-skating rink where a BOY is spinni GIRL around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bevy of girls sunbathe there. Felix walks past them loo around and approaches a row of cabanas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN on Felix as he walks into f.g. then hears voices:

dialogues.speaker: DINK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. Very nice.

dialogues.speaker: A LOUNGE CHAIR
dialogues.text: Bond lies on his stomach as DINK massages his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just here?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: No, a little lower, darling.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I thought I'd find you in good hands.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks back, breaks into a smile and starts to raise himse

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Felix!

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLY BACK as Bond approaches Felix, followed by Dink.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Felix, how are you? They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Dink, meet Felix Leiter.

dialogues.speaker: DINK
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Felix, say hello to Dink.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Hi, Dink.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Dink, say good-bye to Felix.

dialogues.speaker: DINK
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Uh, man-talk. He pivots her around and slaps her butt. She walks off.  10. DOLLY IN as Bond feels his arm then walks into his hut, F following.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: You must be slipping double-o seven, letting the opposition get that close to you. Bond takes a blue terry-cloth top from a chair and puts i

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: They got a lot closer to you in Jamaica, didn't they? -- Well, what's on your mind? I'm on holiday.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (taking out a letter) Not any more, you're not. Signal from London. DOLLY IN as Bond takes it from him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I might have known "M" wouldn't book me into the best hotel in Miami Beach out of pure gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: He asked us to keep an eye on him for you.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (reading the cable) Auric Goldfinger. Sounds like a French nail varnish.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: He's British, but he doesn't sound like it. Big operator, world-wide interests, all apparently quite reputable. Owns one of the finest stud farms in the States.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (zipping up his top) What's the tie-up with Washington?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: He's clean as far as C.I1.A.'s concerned.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And where do I find him?  11. Felix points off. Bond looks that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AURIC GOLDFINGER, wearing a yellow top and a hearing aid, walks down some stairs from an upper deck. He looks off grumpily and keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: (pointing the other way) That's his pigeon waiting for him now. Bond looks off.

dialogues.speaker: THE POOL
dialogues.text: SIMMONS sits in a chair at a poolside table shuffling a d of cards in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Goldfinger's been taking him to the cleaners every day for a week.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: walks past sunbathers then sees Simmons and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Goldfinger walks up to Simmons.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mister Simmons. Ready for our little game?

dialogues.speaker: SIMMONS'
dialogues.text: Sure I'm ready. When you're ten grand in the hole, you're ready for anything.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (pointing to Simmons' chair) Could I have my usual seat?

dialogues.speaker: SIMMONS
dialogues.text: (rising) Oh, you and your suntan!  12.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND FELIX
dialogues.text: As Bond picks up his towel:

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: That Goldfinger's a fabulous card player.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Goldfinger picks up a pencil and starts to write on a not

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Same stakes?

dialogues.speaker: SIMMONS
dialogues.text: Let's double it. Five dollars a point. Goldfinger looks up in surprise then takes a hearing-aid amplifier from his pocket and turns up the volume.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Did you say five?

dialogues.speaker: SIMMONS
dialogues.text: My luck's got to change sometime.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (returning the amplifier to his pocket) Okay. He writes on the notepad. Simmons sets the deck of cards the table.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND FELIX
dialogues.text: Bond now has the towel over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I'll get back to the office and cable "M" you're on the job.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You can fill me in on the rest at dinner.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll call you later. Felix walks off. Bond keeps looking at Goldfinger.  13.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE
dialogues.text: The two men hold cards. Goldfinger takes one from the dec Bond walks toward the table. He stops for a moment, watch then walks closer. Goldfinger takes another card. Bond looks from the men to the hotel. Goldfinger suddenly lays his cards down.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Four.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMONS
dialogues.text: (stunned) So soon? Bond keeps looking at the hotel, then back at the table.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: SIMMONS
dialogues.text: Seven, twelve, eighteen, thirty- two, forty-four... Goldfinger laughs. Bond keeps looking at the table, then circles behind it looking over Goldfinger's shoulder, then walks off. Goldfinger smiles at Simmons. Simmons shuffles the cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK after a MAID walking down the hall. Bond rounds a corner up ahead and walks to her.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Miss? He takes a key hanging by a cord from her waist and, pull her with him, unlocks a door (number 905).

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you...? But that's Mister Goldfinger's suite!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (happily) Yes, I know.  14. He opens the door, starts to enter then looks back at her

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You're very sweet. He closes the door behind him. The maid walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN then DOLLY ALONGSIDE Bond as he walks through a well- appointed reception room to a glass door to a veranda. As approaches the door we hear a female voice outside -- tha

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He just drew the king of clubs. That makes his hand fifty-nine. He's got a diamond run, eight, nine, ten. Bond starts to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: THE VERANDA
dialogues.text: Jill lies face-down on a chaise lounge looking downward through fixed binoculars and talks into a microphone atta to an intercom.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: He's holding onto the six of spades...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill lies face-up as Bond looks at her through the open doorway behind her.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (into the microphone) ... SO I guess he thinks you want it. That last draw was the eight of hearts. Bond approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: She lies face-down, still talking, unaware of Bond behind

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: He needs kings and queens. Bond reaches down and turns off the intercom.  15.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: lying face-down whirls around to face him.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: DOLLY IN as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Bond. James Bond. He looks down.

dialogues.speaker: THE POOL AREA
dialogues.text: The view from the veranda shows everything.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Goldfinger tries raising the volume on his amplifier. Simmons looks at his cards. DOLLY IN on Goldfinger touching his earpiece. Simmons looks up irritated.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMONS
dialogues.text: Come on, come on! Goldfinger randomly throws down a card. Simmons grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: __ SIMMONS
dialogues.text: (happily) Ah! That's more like it!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE VERANDA
dialogues.text: CRANE DOWN with Bond as he sits beside Jill, who sits fac

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Jill.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Jill who? Bond looks through the binoculars.  16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Simmons' entire hand. Simmons sets a card down, t Goldfinger's hand reaches in and takes a card from the de

dialogues.speaker: JILL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jill Masterson.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (looking at her) Tell me, Jill. Why does he do it?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: He likes to win.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (looking through the binoculars again) Why do you do it?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: He pays me.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (looking back at her) Is that all he pays you for?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: And for being seen with him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Just seen?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (emphatically) Just seen.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'm so glad. He looks through the binoculars again and sees Simmons se down another card.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You're much too nice to be mixed up in anything like this, you know. He reaches down.

dialogues.speaker: THE INTERCOM
dialogues.text: Bond turns it on again.  17.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND GOLDFINGER, (THROUGH BINOCULARS)
dialogues.text: Bond snaps his fingers against the microphone. Goldfinger suddenly looks up, quaking from the noise. Bond looks through the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Now hear this, Goldfinger. Goldfinger looks up at his balcony.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Your luck has just changed. Goldfinger keeps looking up.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I doubt very much if the Miami Beach police would take kindly to what you're doing. He grins at Jill then looks back through the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Nod your head if you agree. Goldfinger sits in silent fury.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Nod! Goldfinger nods as subtly as he can.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Good. Now start losing, Goldfinger. Shall we say, eh, ten thousand dollars? (looks at Jill) No, let's be generous. Let's make it fifteen thousand. Goldfinger's face reflects even greater anger.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (to Bond) May I see? Bond leans back helpfully. Jill sits up and looks through binoculars. Bond sniffs her hair.  18.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TABLE
dialogues.text: Goldfinger reluctantly throws another card down, his gaze moving from his balcony. Simmons takes it.

dialogues.speaker: SIMMONS
dialogues.text: Well, I can see this is really my day! (lays his cards down) Gin!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE VERANDA
dialogues.text: Jill smiles and leans back. Bond looks through the binocu again.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: has a snarling expression on his face. The binoculars til down in time to see him snap his pencil in half. He jabs end of it into the tabletop.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Over and out. He looks over and switches off the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: TWO-SHOT
dialogues.text: She looks up at him smiling.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: That should keep him occupied for some time. SLOW DOLLY IN.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: I'm beginning to like you, Mister Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (laying his arm against her face) No, call me James.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: More than anyone I've met in a long time, James.  19.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, what on earth are we going to do about it?

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Yes... What?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'll tell you at dinner.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, I know the best place in town. He pulls the couch and her head toward him and kisses her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT on the remains of a meal. PAN OVER to the bed. First we just see Bond's and Jill's feet rubbing against other. Then, PANNING FURTHER, we see them embracing and kissing, Bond shirtless and Jill in panties wearing his s PAN even further -- to the nightstand where a portable ra is playing.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Station W.E.D.S. brings you the latest in world news. Washington. At the White House this afternoon, the President said he was entirely satisfied... Bond's hand reaches over and switches the radio off. PAN to the bed and DOLLY IN as Bond wraps his arms around Jil again.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: That makes two of us. They start to kiss.

dialogues.speaker: A TELEPHONE
dialogues.text: rings.

dialogues.speaker: THE BED
dialogues.text: Bond rolls over and answers the phone.  20.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Hello. FELIX (over phone) Leiter here.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, Felix. He swings his legs off the bed. FELIX (over phone) Well, now?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Uh, what's that? Jill rises behind him, puts her chin on his shoulder and a lock of her hair against her ear.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Dinner? Uh, no. Look, I'm sorry, I can't. Something big's come up. FELIX (over phone) Right. Bond scratches his ear and pushes the hair away.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Uh, how about breakfast? FELIX (over phone) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: (whispering into Bond's ear) Not too early. Bond cups a hand over the phone, plants his other hand on face and shoves her back. PAN on her as she lands on the smiling and pulls her shirt down. FELIX (over phone) I'll call you around nine.

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes, nine o'clock will be fine.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: FELIX (over phone) So long, James.  21.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Good night, Felix. He hangs up then looks at Jill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks back at him seductively, lips parting.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: smiles. PAN on him as he lays atop her, then:

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh, it's lost its chill.

dialogues.speaker: CHAMPAGNE BOTTLE
dialogues.text: Bond's hand is feeling the bottle. He picks it up. TILT U as he raises it.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Why, you...

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: It's all right. There's another in the fridge. Bond gets up. Jill rolls over to face him, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: Who needs it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond sets the bottle on a dressing table and picks up his bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: My dear girl, there are some things that just aren't done... PAN on him as he walks into the kitchen putting on the bathrobe. A bamboo screen separates the kitchen from the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: ... such as drinking Dom Perignon â€˜fifty-three above a temperature of thirty-eight degrees Fahrenheit. That's as bad as listening to the Beatles without ear-muffs. He opens the refrigerator and kneels.  22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks in the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Now, where is this passion juice? A MAN'S HAND suddenly comes up into frame. He wears a bla jacket. DOLLY IN as the hand approaches bond. Bond opens a refrigerator drawer, finding the champagne bottle and tak it. The hand gives Bond a sharp karate chop on the neck, knoc him to the floor. TILT DOWN as he falls, face-up, the bot rolling beside him.

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL
dialogues.text: The man's shadow appears on wood paneling on the kitchen He turns sideways. He is thickly built and sports a bowle hat. He is ODDJOB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bond lies unconscious in f.g., the shadow on the wall away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and the champagne bottle lie on the floor. DOLLY BACK. Bond begins to move, regaining consciousness. rolls onto his side and slowly lifts himself. He braces a hand on the stove and feels the side of his head, then st moving off.

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN ENTRYWAY
dialogues.text: Bond emerges around the bamboo screen and walks forward.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (calling) Jill?! He turns a corner then suddenly stops, turns on the light looks off aghast.

dialogues.speaker: THE BED
dialogues.text: Jill lies face-down naked, coated in gold paint, one arm hanging over the side of the bed -- dead.  23.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks unmoving.

dialogues.speaker: JILL
dialogues.text: lying there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face registers terrible concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN and TILT UP on Bond as he moves to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: JILL'S UPPER TORSO
dialogues.text: Her entire face and hair are painted gold. She looks oddl serene.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: sits on the bed beside her and touches her shoulder. His expression shows he recognizes she is dead. He picks up the phone. DOLLY IN closer. RECEPTIONIST (on phone) Yes, Mister Bond?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Beach seven-nine-four-three- two, room one-one-nine... As he waits he looks at

dialogues.speaker: JILL'S LEGS
dialogues.text: which are completely painted gold.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: waiting for a response. Then: FELIX' VOICE (over phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Hello, Felix? Get over here right away. FELIX (over phone) What's up?  24.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: The girl's dead. FELIX (over phone) (in alarm) Dink?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: No, Masterson. Jill Masterson. And she's covered in paint. Gold paint.

dialogues.speaker: A BLUE SKY
dialogues.text: dotted with clouds. TILT DOWN to reveal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Ben and Westminster Palace in f.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond stands at attention in f.g., "M" in b.g. by a window looking at him. oye Gold? All over?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (nodding) She died of skin suffocation. It's been known to happen to cabaret dancers. TRACK LEFT as "M" paces toward a bookcase.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: It's all right provided you leave a small bare patch at the base of the spine to allow the skin to breathe. TRACK RIGHT as "M" paces back toward the window. oye Somebody obviously didn't.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And I know who. "mM" stops and walks up to him.  25. myn This isn't a personal vendetta, double-o-seven. It's an assignment like any other. And if you can't treat it as such, coldly and objectively, then double-o-eight can replace you. PAN on "M" as he walks behind his desk. myn You've hardly distinguished yourself, have you? You were supposed to observe Mister Goldfinger, not borrow his girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND "M"
dialogues.text: Bond looks patiently at "M" as "M" gives him his "medicin "M"â„¢ (0.S.) Instead of that, Goldfinger goes off to Europe and it's only by the grace of God, your friend Leiter, and my intervention with the British Embassy in Washington that you're not in the custody of the Miami Beach police.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Sir, I'm aware of my short-comings. But I am prepared to continue this assignment in the spirit you suggest -- if I knew what it was about... sir. myn (putting on his glasses) What do you know about gold? -- Not paint, bullion.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I know it when I see it. "M" picks up a piece of paper and reads it. myn (without looking up) Meet me here at seven. Black tie. Bond looks back at "M" then turns and walks to the door. continues reading the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MISS MONEYPENNY turns from a filing cabinet with a file a Bond emerges through the outer doorway of "M's" office. H closes the padded door behind him. DOLLY IN closer.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And what do you know about gold, Moneypenny? PAN on Bond as he walks to the hat-rack and takes his hat

dialogues.speaker: MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: (leaning back against her desk) Oh, the only gold I know about is the kind you wear... (holding her hand up) ... you know, third finger of your left hand? DOLLY IN further as Bond approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Hmm. One of these days we really must look into that.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: Well, what about tonight? (she takes his hat) You come round for dinner... She tosses his hat. In an insert, it lands on the hat-rac

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: and I'll cook you a beautiful angel cake. Bond, looking in surprise at the hat-rack, turns back to Moneypenny.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Nothing would give me greater pleasure. But unfortunately, I do have a business appointment. She pushes him back and walks behind her desk.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: That's the flimsiest excuse you've ever given me. Ah, well, some girls have all the luck. Who is she, James?  27. Just then "M's" voice comes over the intercom: "M" (filtered) She is me, Miss Moneypenny.

dialogues.speaker: IN "M'S" OFFICE
dialogues.text: "M" stands over his intercom holding a switch down. myn And kindly omit the customary by- play with double-o-seven. He's dining with me and I don't want him to be late.

dialogues.speaker: IN MISS MONEYPENNY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Bond shuts off the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: (surprised) So there's hope for me yet? Bond kisses her cheek then walks to the hat-rack.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Moneypenny, won't you ever believe me? He takes his hat and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: She sits behind her desk smiling as we hear the door clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In MEDIUM CLOSE SHOT we see three men sitting at the tabl COLONEL SMITHERS at the head of the table, "M" on the lef Bond on the right. Each has a brandy snifter in front of and there is a decanter in front of Smithers. "M" takes a sip. A servant, BRUNSKILL, walks over holding a cigar box. He offers it to "M" who takes a cigar, then crosses behind B and offers it but Bond waves him off. At the same time we PULL BACK across the extremely long t until we see a candelabra at each end and an end table in  28.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: We here at the Bank of England, Mister Bond, are the official depository for gold bullion, just as Fort Knox, Kentucky is for the United States. We know, of course, the amounts we each hold, we know the amounts deposited in other banks, and we can estimate what is being held for industrial purposes. This enables the two governments to establish respectively the true value of the dollar and the pound. Consequently, we are vitally concerned with unauthorized leakages.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I take it you mean...

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: ...smuggling.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: Yes. Brunskill holds the box out to Smithers and he takes a ci then hands it back so Brunskill can clip its end. Meanwhi "M" off-screen lights his cigar and blows out a puff of s

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: Gold, gentlemen, which has been melted down and recast, is virtually untraceable, which makes it, uh, unlike diamonds, ideal for smuggling, attracting the biggest and most ingenious criminals. Brunskill, bowing slightly, hands Smithers the clipped ci

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: Thank you, Brunskill. That will be all.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNSKILL
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. Brunskill exits. Smithers picks up the decanter and hands to Bond.  29.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: Have a little more of this, uh, rather disappointing brandy.

dialogues.speaker: "M"
dialogues.text: oye Well, what's the matter with it?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (looking at the decanter) I'd say it was a thirty-year-old fiend indifferently blended, sir... oye holding his snifter, looks at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: takes out the stopper and sniffs the contents.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: . with an overdose of Bon Bois. oye oye Colonel Smithers is giving the lecture, double-o-seven.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: pouring some brandy from the decanter into his glass, fre

dialogues.speaker: THREE -SHOT
dialogues.text: The decanter with the stopper in it now sits on the table front of Bond, his hand on it.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, Mister Goldfinger has gold bullion on deposit in Zurich, Amsterdam, Caracas and Hong Kong, worth twenty million pounds. Most of it comes from this country. Bond passes him the decanter.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, why move it? Smithers passes the decanter to "M."  30.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: Because the price of gold varies from country to country. If you buy it here at thirty dollars an ounce, you can sell it in, say, Pakistan at a hundred and ten dollars and triple your money... oye holding the stopper in his hand, sniffs at the decanter t looks up at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ... providing, of course, you have the facilities for melting it down.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And has he?

dialogues.speaker: THREE -SHOT
dialogues.text: "M" puts the stopper back in the decanter and sets it dow

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: (lowers his cigar) Apart from being a legitimate bullion dealer, Mister Goldfinger poses -- eh, no, that's not quite fair...

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: now holds the cigar at his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: . is, among his many other interests, a legitimate international jeweler. He's, uh, legally entitled to operate modest metallurgical installations.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: sits thinking.  31.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: His British one is down in Kent. As yet, we have failed to discover how he transfers his gold overseas, and Lord knows we've tried. (he turns to "M") If your department can establish that it is done illegally, then the Bank could institute proceedings to recover the bulk of his holdings. "M" looks on in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I think it's time Mister Goldfinger and I met -- socially, of course.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: I was hoping you'd say that. Smithers rises. PAN on him as he walks off frame, leaving in f.g. oye It might lead to a business talk -- Mister Goldfinger's kind of business.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'll need some sort of bait.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I quite agree.

dialogues.speaker: THREE -SHOT
dialogues.text: TRACK with Smithers as he returns to the table holding an object wrapped in green cloth.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: This is the only one we have, from the Nazi hoard from the bottom of Lake Toplitz in the Salzkammergut, but there are undoubtedly others. He sets it on the table and unwraps the covering, reveali  32.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mister Bond can make whatever use of it he thinks fit...

dialogues.speaker: THREE -SHOT
dialogues.text: Smithers sits back in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: SMITHERS
dialogues.text: providing he returns it, of course. It's worth five thousand pounds. He lifts his snifter.

dialogues.speaker: THE BAR OF GOLD
dialogues.text: gleams beautifully.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks at it then reaches forward.

dialogues.speaker: THE BAR OF GOLD
dialogues.text: Bond's hand touches it. oye holds a hand up, stopping him. oye You'll draw it from "Q" branch with the rest of your equipment in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks back at him and straightens his cuff.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: But of course, sir. oye grins enigmatically at Bond then raises his snifter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TwO MEN in a glass cubicle wearing gas masks face a parki meter. One of them puts a coin into it. White gas instant shoots from it, filling the cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond stands outside the cubicle watching the gas expand. DOLLY BACK as Bond walks with a hand in his pocket to a b "Q" bends over the bench beside a sitting man and points object he's working on. Bond picks up a hand grenade and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Good morning, "Q." "Q" immediately takes it from him and sets it down ina container. Ng" Good morning, double-o-seven. This way, please. DOLLY WITH THEM as they walk away from the bench.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: My, we are busy this morning. TwO MEN in an alcove behind them come into view. One wear trench coat, the other aims a machine gun at him. Suddenl the gunner fires at the other man. Bond and "Q" react and look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunner keeps firing. The other man looks to one side, apparently not feeling the shots. The gunner stops shooti and the other man pulls back his trench coat, revealing a bullet-proof vest. He looks down at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man lowers his hands and feels his crotch as the shoo looks on. The man looks at the shooter then feels his cro again. "Q" turns to Bond. Ng" It's not perfected yet.  34.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Where's my Bentley? It's had its day, I'm afraid. DOLLY BACK as they walk forward. A large "NO SMOKING" sig comes into view behind them.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: But it's never let me down. "M's" orders, double-o-seven. "Q" points off. PAN OVER to reveal a gray Aston-Martin. T license plate, white-on-black, reads "BMT 216A."
You'll be using this Aston-Martin D.B.-Five with modifications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and "Q" look down at the car. Now pay attention, please. "Q" steps over to the car and taps the windshield. No" Windscreen, bullet-proof... (points backwards) as are the side and rear windows. He reaches in, turning a switch on the dashboard. No" Revolving number plates, naturally.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT LICENSE PLATE
dialogues.text: It revolves to a white-on-black plate, 4711-EA-62, then a black-on-white plate, LU-6789, then back to the original plate.

dialogues.speaker: "Q", (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Valid all countries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Q" reaches into his pocket and takes out a small silver DOLLY IN on "Q" and Bond.  35. Here's a nice little transmitting device called a "Homer."

dialogues.speaker: "Q", (0.8.)
dialogues.text: You prime it by pressing that back, like this. You see? He pulls back the outer cover and the device beeps. Then holds up a tiny version of the same device. The smaller model is now standard field issue, to be fitted into the heel of your shoe. Its larger brother is magnetic. He releases the tiny version and it sticks to the larger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond takes the devices from "Q." Right. To be concealed in the car you're trailing while you keep out of sight. "Q" opens the passenger door and sits inside. Reception on the dashboard, here.

dialogues.speaker: THE DASHBOARD
dialogues.text: "Q" presses a button and a small grill on the dashboard o with a humming sound, revealing a green "scope." Audio-visual range a hundred and fifty miles. He turns a dial. An indicator "blip" appears in the middl the scope and makes a beeping sound.

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ingenious -- and useful, too.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Allow a man to stop off for a quick one on route.  36. (exasperated) It has not been perfected after years of patient research and time for that purpose, double-o-seven. "Q" gets out of the car and shuts the door. Bond glances the gadgets in his hand then leans an arm on the roof of car. And incidentally, we'd appreciate its return, along with all your other equipment -- intact, for once, when you return from the field.

dialogues.speaker: BONED
dialogues.text: Well, you'd be surprised the amount of wear-and-tear that goes on out there in the field. Anything else? "Q" walks forward. DOLLY IN on Bond, looking bored. Well, I won't keep you for more than an hour or so if you give me your undivided attention. We've installed some rather interesting modifications. Bond signs and leans more heavily against the car. ugn walks around to the driver's side and points in through t window. You see this arm here? Bond looks in through the passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONSOLE
dialogues.text: "Q's" hand reaches inside and taps the top of the console

dialogues.speaker: "Q", (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Now open the top, and inside are your defense mechanism controls: "Q" opens the top, revealing numerous switches. He points many (but not all) of them.  37.

dialogues.speaker: "Q", (0.8.)
dialogues.text: smoke screen, oil slick, rear bullet-proof screen, and left and right front-wing machine guns. He closes the top.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks on patiently but without much interest.

dialogues.speaker: "Q", (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Now this one I'm particularly keen about. Bond looks inside again.

dialogues.speaker: THE STICK SHIFT
dialogues.text: "Q's" finger points to it.

dialogues.speaker: "Q", (0.8.)
dialogues.text: You see the gear lever here? Now, if you take the top off... (he flips the top open, revealing a red button) ... you'll find a little red button. He closes the top again.

dialogues.speaker: "Q"
dialogues.text: "on Whatever you do, don't touch it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And why not?

dialogues.speaker: "Q"
dialogues.text: He holds his hands over the roof. Because you'll release this section of the roof... (points inside again) and engage and then fire the passenger ejector seat. (throws a hand upwards) Whoosh!  38.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Ejector seat? You're joking!

dialogues.speaker: "Q"
dialogues.text: "on (miffed) I never joke about my work, double- o-seven.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks back chagrined.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A golf shop and large hotel are in b.g. GOLFERS walk past f.g. pulling wheeled golf carts. A gold Rolls Royce is pa near the hotel, and beyond it Bond's Aston-Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The proprietor, BLACKING, winds tape around a golf club i f.g. Goldfinger walks in. He is dressed like his name: brown coat over a yellow sweater, brown striped tie, brow golfing pants and shoes, and he holds a matching brown ca

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Ready, Blacking?

dialogues.speaker: BLACKING
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. DOLLY BACK to reveal Bond in f.g. He wears a purple sweat and black slacks and is looking at a rack of golf clubs.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKING
dialogues.text: (to Goldfinger) Uh, there's an old member dropped by, sir. Same handicap as yours. I wondered if you would rather play with him?

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Where is he? Blacking turns to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKING
dialogues.text: Uh, Mister Bond?  39.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: turns to Blacking.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: BLACKING, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This is Mister Goldfinger.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: turns and looks at Bond. He studies him a moment, then speaks.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks back at Goldfinger.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: keeps looking at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: keeps looking at Goldfinger.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKING, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You can go straight off. The first tee is clear.

dialogues.speaker: THREE -SHOT
dialogues.text: DOLLY IN as Bond walks past them to the door.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKING
dialogues.text: I'll get Hawker to carry for you, Mister Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (turning back) Well, that'll be splendid. (to Goldfinger ) Shall we make it a shilling a hole?  40.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Um-hmm. Bond smiles at him and walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bond emerges we hear Goldfinger talking to Blacking:

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll take some tees.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKING, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ah, yes. Of course. Bond suddenly looks ahead and stops.

dialogues.speaker: THE GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: ODDJOB steps into a rigid stance right across from him. A golf bag hangs incongruously from his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Goldfinger comes out of the shop behind him, smiling at B concerned look.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Oh, you must excuse Oddjob, Mister Bond. He's an admirable manservant, but mute. He's not a very good caddy. PAN on them as they walk past Oddjob.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (shrugging at Oddjob) Golf is not yet the national game of Korea, eh? Oddjob waits until they are some distance away then follo

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: Bond stands on a putting green at his ball. He wears a bl hat and takes aim with his putter. Goldfinger's ball is closer to the hole than Bond's. HAWKER stands nearby with Bond's golf bag. Bond putts and sinks the ball.  41. PAN on him as he walks to the hole, revealing Goldfinger approaching with his putter and Oddjob standing nearby. Goldfinger is in his sweater and wears his brown cap.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: This meeting is not a coincidence, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldfinger and Bond stand in f.g., with Oddjob and Hawkin standing in b.g. on opposite sides. Goldfinger leans down with his putter.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: What's your game, Mister Bond?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Bond looks at Goldfinger. - Goldfinger looks down taking aim. - His putter moves back and forth at his ball. - Bond keeps looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: My game? - Goldfinger keeps looking down.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: You didn't come here to play golf. - His putter keeps moving back and forth. Suddenly Bond's gold bar lands beside it with a thud. - Goldfinger's eyes widen as he looks at the bar. - The bar glistens in the sunlight. - Goldfinger looks back at his ball. - His putter taps the ball, which rolls aside missing the hole. - Bond smirks slightly and looks at Goldfinger. - Goldfinger looks at the gold bar again then turns aside  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldfinger hands his putter to Oddjob as Bond picks up th gold bar and gives it to Hawker.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: They walk together across the green.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: The 1940 smelt from the Weigenhaler foundry at Essen.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Part of a smelt of six hundred.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: They vanished in 1944.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: When the Nazis were on the run.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: And you have access to more?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes, from the same source.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach a teeing ground where a marker says "17."

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Two holes to go.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes, and all square. Bond plants his ball on a tee.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Then you have no objection to increasing the stakes?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (getting into putting position) No. What do you have in mind?  43.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: The bar of gold you have with you, naturally.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (looking up) It's worth five thousand pounds.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (laughing it off) Oh, I'll stake the cash equivalent.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Naturally. (he looks nervously down at his ball)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond raises his club to swing.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Strict rules of golf?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: freezes in mid-stroke and lowers the club.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: But of course.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: nods and sways from side to side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond swings at the ball, striking it cleanly across the fairway. Goldfinger watches it go. So does Oddjob.

dialogues.speaker: THE FAIRWAY
dialogues.text: The ball sails far away then lands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling tightly, Bond crosses Goldfinger, who takes a clu from Oddjob and approaches the tee. Bond watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldfinger sets his ball down and readies himself. Ina reverse angle on his legs, his club hits the ball squarel the ball flies into the distance. Goldfinger watches it go. So does Bond, who steps forward grinning.

dialogues.speaker: AN AREA OF ROUGH
dialogues.text: Goldfinger's ball sails across an area of rough and lands some trees.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Bond looks over Goldfinger's shoulder at the rough, Oddjo behind them.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, bad luck. You're in the rough. Goldfinger puts his hand on his hip then walks forward.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: From left to right, Oddjob, Goldfinger, Bond and Hawker l for the ball in the rough.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: paces near the trees, looking down. (Bond is no longer wh he was standing.)

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND HAWKER
dialogues.text: search near the beginning of the rough.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, what a pity. Here it is. They look down at a ball.

dialogues.speaker: HAWKER
dialogues.text: (picking it up) No, it's not. He plays a Slazenger One. Hawker hands Bond the ball. Bond looks at it. It is marke "Slazenger 7."

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: continues to look near the trees.  45.

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (calling) Strict rules of golf, Goldfinger! Five minutes are almost up!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (continuing) A lost ball will cost you stroke and distance! Goldfinger keeps looking through the rough.

dialogues.speaker: ODDJOB
dialogues.text: PAN on him as he walks with a hand in his trouser pocket. stops walking. TILT DOWN to his legs as a ball rolls out his trousers onto the turf. He raises his arm.

dialogues.speaker: ODDJOB
dialogues.text: (calling) Aagh aagh!

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: looks over and waves his club.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND HAWKER
dialogues.text: watch with concealed contempt. Goldfinger walks past them.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (innocently) I'm still training him as a caddy. Oddjob, off to the side, grins at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Successfully, too. He and Hawker walk off.  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldfinger walks to Oddjob in f.g. Meanwhile Bond and Haw walk toward the trees in b.g., looking around. Goldfinger looks down at "his" ball, which lays inches fr the fairway. It is marked "Slazenger 1."

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Slazenger Number One. Good. He holds his hand out. Oddjob passes him a club.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND HAWKER
dialogues.text: Bond stops searching and looks up at Goldfinger. Hawker w up.

dialogues.speaker: HAWKER
dialogues.text: If that's his original ball, I'm Arnold Palmer.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: 'Tisn't.

dialogues.speaker: HAWKER
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'm standing on it. Hawker looks down. Bond raises his foot revealing the bal

dialogues.speaker: HAWKER
dialogues.text: (laughing) Why you crafty old... Hawker starts to reach down.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Leave it. Bond holds up the other ball.

dialogues.speaker: HAWKER
dialogues.text: The ball you found, sir?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes. Slazenger Seven. (looking off) Let's have a little fun with Mister Goldfinger. He slips the ball into his pocket.  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldfinger, in f.g. with his back to us, swings his club strongly then walks forward.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE 17TH HOLE
dialogues.text: Bond's ball lays inches from the cup, Goldfinger's a few away. Bond approaches his ball.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (to Goldfinger) Would you like me to mark it or knock it in?

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Um-hmm, play it. Bond taps his ball into the cup. Goldfinger walks up to his ball.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: This for a half.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: That's right. Goldfinger leans over with his club. In an angle on his l he hits the ball and it rolls into the cup. Bond, hand in his pocket, looks up at him. Goldfinger rises haughtily and grins. Bond glances back at Hawker then, as we TILT DOWN, takes hand from his pocket. We glimpse the hidden ball in his h He reaches into the cup and withdraws two balls. TILT BAC to his face.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (to Goldfinger) One to go. That'll be the clincher.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Fine. Bond tosses a ball to Goldfinger, who reaches out gracefu and catches it. The foursome start walking.  48.

dialogues.speaker: HAWKER
dialogues.text: Did you switch them, sir?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: HAWKER
dialogues.text: Then we've got â€˜em.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: If he doesn't notice the switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close shot of a marker that says "18." TRACK BACK as Goldfinger and Oddjob enter the teeing ground. Goldfinger reaches down with his ball.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND HAWKER
dialogues.text: approach. Hawker looks on, startled.

dialogues.speaker: HAWKER
dialogues.text: It's your honour, sir!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (holding his hand up) It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: bends over and sets his ball on a tee. He rises. The ball falls off the tee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldfinger angles his club then notices the ball on the ground. He reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND HAWKER
dialogues.text: watch in suspense.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: plants the ball on the tee again, then looks into the dis and readies his stroke.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND HAWKER
dialogues.text: keep watching.  49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldfinger swings and hits the ball across the fairway. Hawker smiles at Bond. They walk forward.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The final hole. Goldfinger putts. His ball rolls into the cups Bond's ball is equidistant on the other side of the

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Down in five.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (preparing to putt) I'll have to sink this to have the game, right? Bond putts. The ball curves away from the hole, just miss it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yaagh! You win, Goldfinger.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: It seems I am too good for you. Bond reaches into the cup and takes out both balls. He lo at one.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Hmm. You play a Slazenger One, don't you? Goldfinger, who has been leaning triumphantly on his club approaches.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Yes. Why?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (holding Goldfinger's ball up) This is a Slazenger Seven. Goldfinger takes it. Bond holds up the other ball.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Here's my Penfold Hearts. Goldfinger looks in shock at the ball in his hand.  50.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You must have played the wrong ball somewhere on the eighteenth fairway. We are playing strict rules, so I'm afraid you lose the hole and the match. Goldfinger glares up at Oddjob. Oddjob looks back without expression. Goldfinger hurls his ball to the ground and walks off as smiles. Hawker approaches with the flag, grinning broadly and plants it beside the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gold Rolls Royce sits in f.g., beyond it Bond's Aston Martin. A number of statues adorn the clubhouse fagade. PAN on Oddjob as walks to the Rolls' trunk carrying Goldfinger's golf bag, revealing Bond dressed in a brown looking on with his hands in his pockets. Oddjob sets the in the trunk and backs away. DOLLY IN on Bond as he approaches the trunk. He takes a H from his pocket, primes it and plants it inside the trunk

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING ODDJOB
dialogues.text: DOLLY BACK as he approaches again carrying a folded umbre Bond gently strokes the car's gold exterior as Oddjob set umbrella in the trunk then closes an inner casing and the outer casing. At the same time Goldfinger approaches from the clubhouse b.g. He now wears a formal brown suit and hat. Bond backs away from the car, hands in his pockets, and f Goldfinger.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: She's a beauty! Phantom three thirty-seven, isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLY BACK as he walks up to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: You are a clever, resourceful man, Mister Bond.  51.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Why, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Perhaps too clever. HOLD ON TWO-SHOT as Goldfinger looks Bond in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Twice our paths have crossed. Let's leave it at that. PAN on Goldfinger as he opens the car's back door.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: I should have thought our first meeting would have convinced you.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, I see. PAN on him as he walks over to Goldfinger. Goldfinger's l arm is linked around the window-frame, revealing a gold wristwatch and band, a gold cufflink and a gold ring. Odd stands watching on the other side of the car.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You're worried about me not giving you a return game.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Both of us know perfectly well what we are talking about, Mister Bond. But I see that it is necessary to remind you. Oddjob! PAN on Oddjob as he walks past the front of the car then stands at attention across from them.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Many people have tried to involve themselves in my affairs --

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: -- unsuccessfully. Goldfinger looks off at Oddjob then touches the brim of h hat and points into the distance.  52.

dialogues.speaker: A STATUE
dialogues.text: It is a classic Greek statue of a woman.

dialogues.speaker: ODDJOB
dialogues.text: takes off his bowler hat, steps over to Bond and Goldfing and flings his hat at the statue. The hat flies through the air and crosses the statue, kno the head off. The head and hat land at the base of the statue.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: look up at Oddjob, who walks off to retrieve his hat. DOL IN on Bond and Goldfinger.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Remarkable. But what does the club secretary have to say? GOLDFINGER. Oh, nothing, Mister Bond. I own the club. Goldfinger wipes his eye, opens the car door, gets in and lowers a tabletop.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: I assume you want the check made out to cash.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: That would be perfectly satisfactory. Goldfinger looks at him with a sneer.

dialogues.speaker: ODDJOB
dialogues.text: PAN on him and he returns to the car straightening his ha He passes behind the car to the driver's side. Meanwhile Goldfinger tears a check from his checkbook and hands it Bond.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Mister Bond. Goldfinger shuts his door as Oddjob gets in behind the wh Bond plays with a ball in his hand then tosses it to Oddj who catches it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, uh... I believe this is yours.  53. Oddjob glares at Bond and squeezes the ball. Bond looks o The ball fractures into little pieces that Oddjob flings the ground. Bond rocks back on his heels, suitably impres

dialogues.speaker: THE ROLLS ROYCE
dialogues.text: drives off. Bond turns fingering the check then walks ove his Aston-Martin and reaches inside. Bond's finger presses a button on the dashboard and the g opens, revealing the scope. He turns a dial and the scope glows green, shows a map of the area and blips. The blip indicator is moving away from the center of the scope.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROLLS ROYCE
dialogues.text: The Rolls rises into the air accompanied by a mechanical lifting noise. The front license plate reads "AU1."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is on a hoist beneath an airplane and is being ra to the cargo hatch. PAN on a baggage handler driving by i cart containing four suitcases, one of which is gold-colo As the cart passes under the plane, DOLLY BACK to reveal Goldfinger and Oddjob approaching the steps to the passen compartment. Goldfinger motions to Oddjob, who hands their tickets toa STEWARDESS at the base of the steps, and the two of them up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STOP OF THE STEPS
dialogues.text: Goldfinger takes off his hat as he passes a STEWARDESS at top of the steps and enters the passenger compartment. Od follows keeping his hat on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE BACK from the plane to reveal the Aston-Martin in f and Bond behind the wheel looking at the scope, as we hea announcement:

dialogues.speaker: AIRPORT ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker ) British United Air-ferries announce the departure of their DS-400 flight to Geneva. Suddenly a voice calls out to Bond:  54.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mister Bond? Bond looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLY BACK as the Security Officer approaches Bond.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
dialogues.text: That's all right. I've got you booked out on the next flight to Geneva, leaving in half an hour.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh. Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
dialogues.text: Right, sir. The Security Officer walks off.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks back at the British United plane, which is starting taxi away. He opens the scope on his dashboard and turns the dial. T map alights showing the airport at the center of the scre and the blip indicator moving away from it.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: TILT DOWN from towering mountains to a hilly road. Goldfinger's Rolls Royce drives up the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oddjob drives. Goldfinger sits in back opening a newspape He scratches the side of his face.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Bond's Aston-Martin drives up the road from a town in b.g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond is driving. He looks down at the scope. It shows a map of Geneva. The blip indicating the Rolls i moving up the top half of the scope.  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rolls drives up the road, continuing to head uphill.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK SEAT
dialogues.text: Goldfinger leans back with his hat over his eyes, snoozin He suddenly rubs his nose then relaxes again.

dialogues.speaker: IN BOND'S CAR
dialogues.text: Bond looks down impatiently at the scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aston-Martin navigates a bend in the road. Just then yellow Ford Mustang rounds a corner behind it, following. Bond look in the rearview mirror. It shows the Mustang following. Then Bond's expression grows more interested a he looks back.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MUSTANG
dialogues.text: An attractive blonde is driving -- TILLY MASTERSON -- but expression is grim. She honks her horn.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROAD
dialogues.text: The Mustang comes alongside the Aston-Martin.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks over with an interested expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang races ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: grins. He looks ahead again at the Mustang, which now races perilously fast. Bond prepares to put on more speed but catches himself an slows down.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Discipline, double-o-seven. (unhappily) Discipline.  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mustang heads up the road. Inside, Tilly looks forwar grimly.

dialogues.speaker: IN BOND'S CAR
dialogues.text: He looks down at the scope again. The blip indicator has become stationary, showing no movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rolls is stopped at the flower stall, which is manned five children. Goldfinger and Oddjob get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oddjob walks up to one of the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps driving, his expression impatient.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROAD
dialogues.text: The Aston-Martin continues up the road.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Oddjob stands beside the Rolls as Goldfinger approaches t children. SLOWLY ZOOM BACK to an extreme long shot reveal a much higher road in f.g. Bond's car has stopped on the high road and he gets out a looks down at Goldfinger.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: turns away from the flower stall eating an orange. Oddjob behind him (in a process shot), approaches the children a

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: He stands on the high road looking down at Goldfinger. SL ZOOM BACK to an even longer shot revealing an even higher in f.g. A rifle barrel comes into view, aiming below, and then Ti lying prone and bracing the rifle on a boulder. She fires

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: The bullet strikes the pavement right in front of him. He ducks down then lies flat behind his car.  57.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: moves away with the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER'S CAR
dialogues.text: Goldfinger gets back inside. Oddjob looks up at the hills and smirks, then gets behind the wheel. The Rolls drives away from the flower stall. ON a ROAD Tilly's car rounds a bend and heads downhill. Bond's car emerges from a side road behind her and follows.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks ahead now with determination.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROAD
dialogues.text: The two cars race down the road, Bond right behind Tilly. When they reach the flower stall, Bond passes her and spe ahead. Tilly follows, almost on his bumper, honking at hi

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - Bond looks in his rearview mirror and grins, enthused b chase. - The mirror shows the Mustang following fast. - TRUCKING SHOT: The Aston-Martin races around a bend, th Mustang right behind it and trying to pass it. - Tilly sounds her horn again. - Bond, grinning more broadly, checks his rearview mirror - TRUCKING SHOT: The Aston-Martin starts swerving to bloc the Mustang from passing. A long horn blast sounds from t Mustang. - Bond politely gestures to the Mustang to pass him. - The Mustang swerves to the other side of the road. - Bond looks over at it. - His hand opens the console, revealing his weapon contro - The Aston-Martin races by with the Mustang almost besid - Bond reaches down.  58. - CLOSE SHOT - A REAR WHEEL: A hub decoration opens to re cutting blades on a spindle. They extend from the wheel o rod. - Tilly looks in her rearview-mirror. - Blades from Bond's front wheel slam into a front tire o Mustang. - Tilly looks over and screams. - Blades now retract from the Mustang's shredded rear tir then slam into it again and retract again. - Tilly's car skids off the road; both passenger-side tir are blown. - She clutches the steering wheel as her car bounces to a stop, then she strokes her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aston-Martin has stopped at the side of the road. Bon runs out, slamming the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY'S CAR
dialogues.text: Bond runs up to her.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Here, let me help you. He opens the driver's door and she steps out.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You know, you're lucky to be alive.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: No thanks to you. You should have pulled over further. She crosses behind the back of her car and looks at her t The rear tire is completely shredded.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: Look at them!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: A double blow-out! I've never seen one of these before.  59. Tilly looks over at Bond's car. It sits innocently on the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: How could new tires...?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Defect of some kind, most likely. (sits on the edge of her trunk) Anyway, I'm so glad that it's only the car and not you. You don't look like the sort of girl who should be ditched.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: Never mind that. Please take me to the nearest garage.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Certainly. She crosses back to the driver's side and grabs her handb Bond follows.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: By the way, my name Is Bond. Would you --

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: Um, as quickly as possible. She goes to the trunk. He shuts the driver's door. She op the trunk, takes out a suitcase and sets it down as he ta briefcase from her back seat.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: I'll take that.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (handing it to her) Yes, of course. He picks up the suitcase and follows her to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond drives, Tilly beside him. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: What's your name, by the way?  60.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: Soames. Tilly Soames. Bond glances in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY'S CASE
dialogues.text: sits on the back seat ledge with the initials "T.M." mark it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Here for the hunting season? TI had a case just like that one. She glances back.

dialogues.speaker: HER CASE
dialogues.text: The initials on it are very visible.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: It's for my ice skates.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Lovely sport. Where do you skate?

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: Saint Moritz.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I didn't know there was ice there this time of the year.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: (suddenly points) There's a garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond's car drives in front b.g. and stops in f.g. Tilly immediately opens her door and gets out. She walks past t gas pumps toward the office.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: (calling) Fraulein!

dialogues.speaker: IN BOND'S CAR
dialogues.text: He reaches down to open the scope. Meanwhile, we hear Til  61.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (angrily) I've had an accident.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCOPE
dialogues.text: Bond turns the dial activating the scope. It alights. The beep indicator is stationary again, near a mountainside. Puzzled, Bond looks off as if the source is nearby, then looks at the scope again. The indicator remains stationary. We hear Tilly again:

dialogues.speaker: TILLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How long will it take?... Thank you. Appreciate it. Bond looks down and turns off the scope then opens the do and starts to step out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond emerges from the car as Tilly walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: They say it'll take twenty-four hours to get new tires. There's a hotel nearby.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, jump in. I'll run you down.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: That won't be necessary.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, I hate to leave you here alone. Bond reaches into the car and hands Tilly her suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm sure you can. Bond reaches in again and hands her her briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (smiling to her) Well, don't forget to write. He gets in and shuts the door, leaving her there alone.  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aston-Martin backs away, turns, then heads back down road as Tilly watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN on the Aston-Martin as it rounds a bend across froma large green hillside. A factory complex at the base of th hillside comes into view. A sign on its main building say

dialogues.speaker: "AURIC ENTERPRISES."
dialogues.text: The car stops across from the factory and Bond looks over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is an imposing edifice.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: gazes at the complex then leans forward and looks up high

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S CAR
dialogues.text: He drives off. TILT UP to the top of the hillside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond, with a pair of binoculars around his neck, walks do from the crest of the hill. PAN on him till the factory b comes into view. He sits under a tree with his back to us looks through the binoculars at the factory.

dialogues.speaker: THE FACTORY
dialogues.text: Goldfinger's Rolls Royce sits in front of one of the buildings. Two GUARDS in blue jumpsuits tied with yellow sashes look inside it as THREE OTHER GUARDS approach.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: He rests his arms on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond sits on the hillside again, arms on knees, but dress all in black. He glances at his watch.  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: overlooking the factory. Lights show in some of the windo Bond starts to creep down the hill. He wears a black backpack.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BASE OF THE HILL
dialogues.text: Bond runs from the hillside onto a factory road, crosses and stops beside a brick building. He flattens his back against it for a moment then moves on. Just then two men in blue jumpsuits round the far corner the building, speaking together in Korean.

dialogues.speaker: A CONCRETE BUILDING
dialogues.text: DOLLY BACK and PAN on Bond as he passes the building. The shadows of the other men cross it. He looks back then run ahead.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SIDE OF THE BUILDING
dialogues.text: Bond rounds the corner and leans back against the buildin then glances back. The other men round the corner of the building behind him. They are laughing. Bond runs off, passing some metal drums and a sign on a w that says, in German, "EINTRITT STRENGSTENS VERBOTEN" ("e strictly forbidden"). He quickly finds himself in a dead- blocked by another building. He looks back desperately.

dialogues.speaker: ALONGSIDE THE BRICK BUILDING
dialogues.text: The two guards continue forward.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: runs back past the sign, mounts a fire-escape ladder and starts climbing up. He stops on a ledge, then climbs up t the next level.

dialogues.speaker: ON A LEDGE
dialogues.text: Louvers on the building's windows provide ventilation. Bo comes around the corner, stopping on the ledge near the louvers. He looks down to see the two guards turn the oth way. Then he turns to the louvers and looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BUILDING
dialogues.text: Goldfinger's Rolls is partially dismantled. WORKERS -- al them wearing blue jumpsuits and yellow sashes -- pass to from it as red smoke rises from a furnace in b.g.  64.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: tilts the louvers so he can have a better view. He looks inside again.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FACTORY
