dialogues.text: The Roll's grill is in f.g. A worker removes one of the golden headlamps, walks back and sets it down. Meanwhile others remove one of the golden doors, carry it back and it down. At the same time, Goldfinger and LING -- a Chinese operat in a Mao jacket -- approach from b.g.:

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Smuggling is an art, Mister Ling...

dialogues.speaker: OTHER WORKERS
dialogues.text: They pour molten gold into an ingot mold.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: and art requires... Steam sounds from the melted gold, drowning out the rest his sentence.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (continuing) In this case, the bodywork of my Rolls Royce is eighteen carat gold.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: keeps looking in through the louvers, excited at his find

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Goldfinger escorts Ling past a dolly bearing gold ingots.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: We dismantle it here. We reduce the gold in this special furnace, which in turn... (noise drowns him out) . weighing approximately two tons. He raises his fist to his mouth, coughing, then leads Lin off.  65.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: I make six trips a year to the continent in the Rolls Royce, Mister Ling...

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Bond looks downward in satisfaction. He has solved his ca He looks again through the louvers, then suddenly looks t side.

dialogues.speaker: THE FACTORY ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Ling exits the factory then leans against a railing as Goldfinger follows.

dialogues.speaker: LING
dialogues.text: Perhaps it would be wiser to suspend your other activities.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Now, Mister Ling, please assure your principals Operation Grand Slam will have my undivided attention. Goldfinger leads him down a few steps and around a corner the building.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Now, there are certain matters we must discuss...

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: TILT UP as he rises above the louvers, looks to one side moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond runs along the side of the building. He stops, plant his back again it, then darts to the bottom of the hillsi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond jumps over some barbed wired and heads into the wood  66.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WOODS
dialogues.text: - Bond sits on the ground and removes his backpack, looki down at the factory. He rubs his left arm. Suddenly he he a TWIG SNAP and looks up. - Someone is moving through the trees. - Bond runs forward then dives onto his belly. - He looks forward then lowers his head again. - The other person continues through the trees. - Bond lowers his head further then looks up. - The other person stalks forward holding a rifle. - Bond rounds the side of a tree and looks ahead. - The other person moves further ahead, then lies down pr and aims the rifle forward. - Bond dives at the shooter as the rifle is cocked. He pounces. The rifle's barrel tilts up, snagging a wire.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FACTORY
dialogues.text: - A red light suddenly glows on a sensor board accompanie a wailing sound. - WIDER ANGLE: A Korean guard gets on a phone as another at the board.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WOODS
dialogues.text: Bond rolls over holding the shooter. Her face enters the moonlight. It is Tilly.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: Let me go! You're breaking my back! Bond recognizes her but keeps holding her.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: I want to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Kill who?  67.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: Goldfinger.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well I want him alive.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: I want him dead. He killed my sister.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: T.M. Tilly Masterson! I knew your sister, Jill. I know what he died to her in Miami.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: No you don't! Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: If you wanted to kill him, why did you shoot at me?

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: I didn't! I was shooting at him!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, you're a lousy shot. A rifle fires.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: But somebody else around here isn't. Come on! He pulls her to her feet as a rifle fires again. They run into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Bond and Tilly run through the woods, then suddenly stop look ahead.

dialogues.speaker: A KOREAN GUARD
dialogues.text: stands between two Mercedes Benz cars and calls out in Ko

dialogues.speaker: TWO OTHER GUARDS
dialogues.text: in the woods hear him and turn forward.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND TILLY
dialogues.text: PAN on them as they run to Bond's Aston-Martin. A guard blocks their path.  68.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Quick! Get in the car! I'll take care of him. Tilly runs toward the Aston-Martin. Bond grabs the guard from behind and smashes his head aga the first Mercedes. The guard drops to the ground. Bond jumps forward.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - ANGLE ON THE ASTON-MARTIN: Tilly is already inside. Bon bounds into the driver's seat and starts the engine. The headlights go on. - Three Korean guards run through the woods. - The Aston-Martin takes off. PAN over as the three Korea arrive at the first Mercedes. - Another three Koreans run around the front of the secon Mercedes, yelling in Korean. - ON THE ROAD: The doors of the second Mercedes slam shut it takes off. - WIDER ANGLE: It passes the first Mercedes where the oth three Koreans are lifting their comatose companion. - ON THE ROAD: PAN on the Aston-Martin as it races by. - PAN on the second Mercedes as it races after it. - The first Mercedes takes off. - Bond looks in his rearview mirror. Tilly looks back. - PAN on the second Mercedes as it races after them. A gu with a machine gun leans out the rear window on the drive side. - CLOSE SHOT - THE GUNMAN: He fires at the Aston-Martin. - Tilly ducks then looks at Bond. - Bond looks in the rearview mirror then down at the cons - CLOSE SHOT - THE CONSOLE: Bond's hand opens it to revea the defense mechanism controls. - Bond looks in the rearview mirror again. - CLOSE SHOT - THE CONSOLE: His finger flips a switch.  69. - EXT. WOODS - SAME TIME: The Aston-Martin races by trail white smoke. - Tilly looks at Bond and smiles in delight. - Bond grins, knowing he's showing his prowess. - ON THE ROAD: Bond's car races by, trailing darker smoke - The second Mercedes enters the haze. - CLOSER: The men in the second Mercedes are dumbfounded. - ON THE ROAD: The second Mercedes runs off the road and crashes into a tree. - The first Mercedes enters the haze. - CLOSER: There are four men inside and all are dumbfound The driver peers through the haze. - ON THE ROAD: The first Mercedes emerges from the smoke passes the second Mercedes. A guard in the passenger seat fires a pistol out the window and a guard in the rear sea the driver's side fires a machine gun. - Bond looks in his rearview mirror as Tilly ducks at the of bullets bouncing off the car. Headlights are visible behind them. - CLOSE SHOT - THE GUNMAN WITH THE PISTOL: keeps firing. - ON THE ROAD: PAN on Bond's car as it races by. - Bond drives with steely determination, headlights visib behind him. - ON THE ROAD: The first Mercedes keeping following, gunm continuing to fire out the windows. - CLOSE SHOT - THE GUNMAN WITH THE PISTOL: fires again. - Bond keeps his eyes on he road. - CLOSE SHOT - THE CONSOLE: Bond's finger flips another switch. - Oil shots out from a tail fin. - ON THE ROAD: The first Mercedes rounds a corner. - Bond looks in the rearview mirror again. - The tail fin continues to shoot oil.  70. - ON THE ROAD: The first Mercedes slides through the oil slick and skids out-of-control off-screen. - LONG SHOT - A CLIFF: The first Mercedes sails over the cliff and bursts into flames on the way down. - A FACTORY ROAD: The Mercedes slides across the road. - THE BRICK BUILDING: It crashes into the building. Two guards run toward it with fire extinguishers. - ON THE ROAD: PAN on the Aston-Martin as it races past. - BOND AND TILLY: They are calmer now, looking ahead. - ON THE ROAD: PAN on the second Mercedes which is sudden chasing them again, a gunman leaning out the window. - BOND AND TILLY: Bullets fire at them from behind. - CLOSE SHOT - BOND: glances in the rearview mirror, anno - BOND'S POV: They reach a fork in the road. They almost right, then take the left branch. - Tilly looks ahead then glances at Bond. - Bond glances back at her then looks ahead. - THEIR POV: Lights suddenly appear in front of them. - Bond grimaces as he hits the brakes. - FRONT ANGLE: DOLLY BACK as the Aston-Martin screeches t halt, then TILT DOWN to reveal it is on a cliff. - CLOSER ANGLE - BOND AND TILLY: Bond glances in the rear mirror as the Mercedes screeches to a halt behind them. - CLOSE SHOT - THE CONSOLE: Bond flips another switch. - ANGLE ON THE REAR OF HIS CAR: The rear bullet-proof scr rises.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Run for that bracken when I tell you. Bond jumps out of the car with a pistol in his right hand ducks behind the open door. A guard ahead calls out in Korean. Bond fires through an open window.  71. - One of the guards falls dead. - Tilly ducks. - FRONT ANGLE: Bond fires again. - Two Koreans fire back. - THE BULLET-PROOF SCREEN: takes some bullets. - Bond, still aiming his gun, glances over at Tilly.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Now! - Tilly jumps out of the car. CRANE UP as she runs into t woods. - Bond fires again. - The Koreans fire back. - Bond ducks behind the car door as bullets hit it. - REAR ANGLE ON TILLY: She continues running into the for ANOTHER MERCEDES: has just pulled up. Oddjob emerges from the back seat and aims his hat. PAN on his hat as he thro - LONG SHOT: Tilly keeps running through the woods as the flies at her. - CLOSE SHOT: The hat strikes her in the neck and she dro - Tilly lands on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Bond looks over at Tilly then back at Oddjob. - Oddjob steps forward. - Bond rises and runs off. - WIDER ANGLE: PAN on Bond as he runs into the woods, the Oddjob comes into view. He strides forward, following, th Korean guard follows him.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: She lies in f.g. Bond approaches and feels her neck. DOLL IN as he turns her onto her back. He feels her wrist.  72.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: He leans back realizing she is dead.

dialogues.speaker: TILLY
dialogues.text: looks serene as she lies there.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: A number of armed Koreans approach in b.g., Oddjob front them. He stops, looking over Bond's shoulder. Bond looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: ODDJOB
dialogues.text: (giving orders to the others) Aagh! Aagh! The others step forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Koreans lift Tilly's body and carry it off as Bond ri Meanwhile Oddjob crosses in f.g. and picks up his hat.

dialogues.speaker: THE WOODS
dialogues.text: PAN as guards lead Bond back to his Aston-Martin. One of aims a pistol at him, yells in Korean and gets into the passenger seat. Bond climbs into the driver's seat. They both close their doors. Bond revs the engine and backs up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A caravan passes by -- first a Mercedes, then Bond drivin Aston-Martin, then another Mercedes. They slow to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ASTON-MARTIN
dialogues.text: Bond looks forward in anger as the guard beside him grips pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Mercedes honks its horn.

dialogues.speaker: THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: An OLD GERMAN WOMAN in the kitchen, peeling potatoes, wip her hands together then against her apron. PAN on her as walks to the front door, opens it, steps out onto the por and walks to a barricade as the three cars wait.  73.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BARRICADE
dialogues.text: The old woman pushes down on her end of the barricade, ra it.

dialogues.speaker: TWO-SHOT
dialogues.text: Bond glances over at the old woman as the guard looks impassively at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: THE OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: curtsies to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks at her then turns forward again and gives us an "Ol Hardy camera look" of total exasperation.

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S GEARSHIFT
dialogues.text: His hand shifts it into gear.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARDHOUSE
dialogues.text: The caravan starts moving forward as the old woman holds the barricade.

dialogues.speaker: IN BOND'S CAR
dialogues.text: He glances at his passenger then looks down.

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S GEAR LEVER
dialogues.text: His hand grips it, ready to flip the top open.

dialogues.speaker: IN BOND'S CAR
dialogues.text: He looks again at the guard then looks forward again.

dialogues.speaker: THE GEARSHIFT
dialogues.text: Bond's hand suddenly pulls the level downward.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - The first Mercedes turns to the left. - BOND: His face registers excitement as he switches gear again. - CLOSE-SHOT - THE GEARSHIFT: Bond's hand shifts it upwar again.  74. - AT THE GUARDHOUSE: The Aston-Martin suddenly speeds off the right. - IN THE ASTON-MARTIN: The guard aims his pistol at Bond' head. - CLOSE SHOT - THE GEARSHIFT: Bond's thumb pops the top o revealing the red button. - TWO-SHOT: DOLLY IN on Bond as he readies his trick. - CLOSE SHOT - THE GEARSHIFT: Bond's thumb presses the re button. - THE KOREAN: He looks up as the roof above him suddenly off and he is propelled upwards. - CLOSE-UP - BOND: looks up at him. - WIDE ANGLE - THE FACTORY: With a scream, the Korean, al with his seat, flies up through the roof of the Aston-Mar and lands on the ground. - BOND: looks behind him and backs up. - LONG SHOT - THE ASTON-MARTIN: backs up almost striking Korean guards running toward it. - OVER BOND'S SHOULDER: He steers to the side. - EXT. THE ASTON-MARTIN: speeds off leaving eight guards behind, including the one who lies prone on the ground as three others surround him. - OVER BOND'S SHOULDER: He races forward, serving to avoi number of Koreans who appear in front of him. - THE ASTON-MARTIN: PAN as it races past the Koreans. - THE OLD GERMAN WOMAN: She suddenly lunges into position the road ahead of us aiming a machine gun. - Bond looks at her in amazement. - The old woman starts firing. - OVER BOND'S SHOULDER: He approaches her as she fires at windshield. Bullets leave cracks in it. - Bond turns his steering wheel to the side. - The old woman keeps firing. - The Aston-Martin races across her lawn as she keeps fir  75. - KOREANS IN F.G.: stand at their Mercedes. Bond races pa them, nearly smashing them against their car. - THREE OTHER KOREANS: fire at him as he races past them. continues past a factory building where other Koreans div of the way. - Bond looks through his bullet-strewn windshield. - WIDE ANGLE: The Aston-Martin nearly runs into other Koreans, then veers to the side. - A FACTORY ROAD: The Aston-Martin rounds the corner of a building in b.g. and races forward. PAN on it as it veers left, knocking over drums and boxes. - ON THE ROAD: A Mercedes round the same corner and nearl runs over three Koreans in f.g., who dive aside, then vee left after Bond. - Bond keeps driving. - TRUCKING SHOT: The Aston-Martin races forward at incred speed, rounding the corners of buildings. - Bond looks ahead. - WIDE ANGLE: PAN on the Aston-Martin as it races past. - SAME ANGLE: PAN on the Mercedes as it races after him. - CLOSER: The Aston-Martin races by followed by the Merce - Bond turns the steering wheel, screeching into a turn. - TRACKING SHOT: The Aston-Martin rounds a corner and rac right at us. - REVERSE ANGLE: The Aston-Martin races into the distance The Mercedes crosses an intersection with the same road. - The Mercedes screeches around the corner of a building men lean out the windows with their guns. - Bond looks ahead, concerned. - BOND'S POV: The headlights of another vehicle seem to approach him. - Bond looks ahead with a steely expression. - BOND'S POV: The headlights continue to approach. - Bond glances from side to side.  76. - OVER BOND'S SHOULDER: The headlights continue to approa Bond shields his eyes. - CLOSE SHOT - THE CONSOLE: Bond's fingers press a button - ANGLE ON THE ASTON-MARTIN'S GRILL: A headlight lowers revealing a machine gun that starts firing. - PAN along the side of a building a bullets hit it. - The machine guns continue to fire. - The oncoming headlights keep approaching. - Bond holds his hand in front of his face. - The oncoming headlights keep approaching. - Bond throws the steering wheel to the side. EXT. FACTORY ROAD: The Aston-Martin crashes into a wall a bricks fall atop it. - A Mercedes pulls up and stops, its yellow headlight rig our face.

dialogues.speaker: THE MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Oddjob alights from the back seat, other Koreans followin with their guns. Oddjob crosses to the crashed Aston-Mart a pillar lays atop it. He looks up.

dialogues.speaker: A MIRROR
dialogues.text: It is mounted above them and reflects the Aston-Martin an Oddjob grinning.

dialogues.speaker: ODDJOB
dialogues.text: turns aside.

dialogues.speaker: THE MIRROR
dialogues.text: shows him moving to the Aston-Martin's driver's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oddjob opens the door. Bond's head falls backwards from t seat, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond lies in darkness on his back on a metal table. He co to. DOLLY BACK as he struggles to rise. He finds his arms and legs are tied to the table. The lights come on with a swooshing sound. Bond looks to side.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Good evening, double-o-seven. Bond looks the other way.

dialogues.speaker: THE LASER ROOM
dialogues.text: The table is in the middle of the room. A laser gun is ai just behind Bond's head. Beyond him, stairs lead up to a control room. Goldfinger walks down the stairs, wearing a gold dinner jacket, a sh with gold buttons and a black bow-tie. Behind him are LIN KISCH, MELLINGER and THREE GUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: My name is James Bond.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (slipping his hands into his pockets) And members of your curious profession are few in number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldfinger approaches the table.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: You have been recognized -- let's say by one of your opposite numbers, who is also licensed to kill. -- Oh, that interesting car of yours! PAN on Goldfinger as he moves to the right. The laser gun comes into view. Goldfinger wipes his eye and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: I, too, have a new toy, but considerably more practical.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: glances up at the laser gun.  78.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You are looking at an industrial laser...

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: . which emits an extraordinary light, not to be found in nature.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: looks down at him and paces back past the table.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: It can project a spot on the moon -- or, at closer range, cut through solid metal. I will show you. Goldfinger turns and snaps his fingers at the control roo Delsing flips a switch as Kisch, Ling and Wong look on. The barrel of the laser gun moves down Bond's torso. He raises himself onto his elbows and looks at it. TILT UP to show its blue coils gleaming as it keeps movin downwards.

dialogues.speaker: THE LASER ROOM
dialogues.text: The barrel of the laser gun comes to rest, aiming between Bond's legs. Suddenly the laser light goes on, gleaming r Bond looks down at it. The laser beam starts cutting the outer edge of the table which is gold-coloured. Goldfinger looks down smiling. Bond looks down not smiling. The laser beam continues burning through the table-top.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (pointing to the table-top) This is gold, Mister Bond. All my life I've been in love with its colour, its brilliance, its divine heaviness. Bond looks up at Goldfinger then down at his legs.  79. The laser beam keeps cutting through the table-top, movin toward Bond's crotch.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: I welcome any enterprise which will increase my stock, which is considerable. Bond looks at Goldfinger then down at his crotch again. The laser beam keeps cutting through the table-top.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I think you've made your point, Goldfinger. Thank you for the demonstration.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (studying the beam) Choose your next witticism carefully, Mister Bond. It may be your last. The laser beam continues cutting upwards. Bond looks at i then up at Goldfinger.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: The purpose of our two previous encounters is now very clear to me. I do not intend to be distracted by another. Good-night, Mister Bond. Goldfinger turns away. Bond looks from Goldfinger to a spot between his legs. Th laser beam keeps cutting upwards toward his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond lies in f.g. on the table as Goldfinger starts walki the steps to the control booth, his left hand in his pock

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Do you expect me to talk?

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: stops on the steps and looks down, both hands in his pock

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: No, Mister Bond. I expect you to die!  80.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Bond looks up at him. Goldfinger continues up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: There is nothing you can talk to me about that I don't already know. Bond looks at the laser beam. It keeps cutting through th table-top. Bond tries to think of something to say.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CONTROL BOOTH
dialogues.text: Goldfinger talks animatedly to Ling. Kisch and Delsing lo on.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks down at the laser beam. It keeps cutting upwards to his crotch. He turns sideways.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (calling) You're forgetting one thing! Goldfinger and Ling turn to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: If I fail to report, double-o-eight replaces me!

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: I trust he will be more successful! Goldfinger touches Ling's arm and they turn away. Bond looks down at the laser beam again. It keeps cutting toward his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, he knows what I know! Goldfinger looks back

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: You know nothing, Mister Bond!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Operation Grand Slam, for instance!  81.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER AND LING
dialogues.text: Ling freezes and looks at Bond but Goldfinger keeps his c He watches Bond and the laser beam about to slice into hi Goldfinger steps forward smirking as Ling looks imploring him. Bond looks up at Goldfinger. The laser beam keeps cutting Bond looks at Goldfinger again. Goldfinger stands consulting with Ling and Kisch. Bond looks again at the tabletop. The beam keeps cutting. Goldfinger continues consulting with the others. Bond looks down at the beam. It is almost at his crotch. Bond looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond in f.g. again, Goldfinger beyond in the control room Goldfinger turns to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Two words you may have overheard which cannot possibly have any significance to you or anyone in your organization. As Goldfinger talks, Bond looks in exasperation at the approaching laser beam. It slices easily through the meta Goldfinger steps forward smugly.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Can you afford to take that chance? Goldfinger hesitates. Bond looks over at him, then back a the table. The beam keeps cutting. Bond looks at Goldfinger again. Goldfinger smiles, relent He turns back and snaps his fingers (soundlessly) at his assistants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laser beam switches off as Kisch walks down the steps the control room.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks up at the laser gun then down at his legs.  82.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: You are quite right, Mister Bond. You are worth more to me alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Bond lies in f.g. and Goldfinger looks on, Kisch appro the table. Bond looks up at Kisch, then Goldfinger, then Kisch. Kisc raises a large pistol and points it at Bond's chest. Goldfinger looks on smugly as Kisch aims. Kisch fires the pistol; it makes a thumping sound. Bond's head lowers to the tabletop. Goldfinger looks on with even greater smugness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the entire tableau -- Bond unconscious, Kisch besi him and Goldfinger looking on. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond lies sleeping in a seat. We hear the hum of the engi He comes to and looks up, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY GALORE
dialogues.text: She is out-of-focus, then comes into focus peering at him She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: My name is Pussy Galore.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I must be dreaming. Pussy looks down at him. Bond looks back at her. She keep looking at him. Bond feels his chest.  83.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I thought I'd wake up dead.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: (holding up a pistol) Tranquilizer gun. Knockout shot.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I see. Well, I 'm delighted to be here. DOLLY BACK as Pussy walks away.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And, uh, by the way: where is here? Pussy sets the pistol down and looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Thirty-five thousand feet, flying south-west over Newfoundland.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, that explains the humming. DOLLY BACK IN.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: The humming means you're on Mister Goldfinger's Jet-Star heading for Baltimore. And you're his guest.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'm honoured. I never realized he enjoyed my company that much.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: I don't suppose it will be all fun and games. (calling off) Mei Li!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Oriental stewardess in a gold top -- MEI LI -- steps t Bond.

dialogues.speaker: MEI LI
dialogues.text: Can I do something for you, Mister Bond?  84.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Uh, just a drink. A martini, shaken, not stirred. Mei Li bows to him and walks off. Bond looks at her butt swivels in his chair to face Pussy.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Won't you join me?

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Not on duty. I'm Mister Goldfinger's personal pilot.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You are? And, uh, just how personal is that?

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: (glaring back at him) I'm a damned good pilot. Period.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, that's good news. And by the way, where is our host?

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: He flew on ahead. PAN OVER from Bond to include Mei Li approaching him with golden cup on a tray. Bond takes the cup.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Thank you. Mei Li turns away. Bond looks at her butt again then face forward and raises his drink. Pussy looks at a clipboard. Bond sips his drink.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, here's to Operation Grand Slam. Pussy, ignoring him, puts the clipboard away. Bond watche her. Pussy opens the door to the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: This should be a memorable flight.  85.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: (turning to him) You can turn off the charm. I'm immune. Bond sips his drink then swivels again in his chair, look back at Mei Li. She stands in b.g. at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane flies through very light clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pussy sits in the pilot's seat beside a female co-pilot, SYDNEY. Pussy picks up a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: (speaking into the mic) We'll be landing in Baltimore...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Bond hears Pussy's voice over a speaker. He holds a brand snifter. Mei Li stands in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... our port of entry into the United States, in fifty-five minutes. Bond rises. DOLLY IN as he walks to Mei Li.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Mei Li, I would like to arrive more, uh, appropriately dressed. (he sits on a barstool) Did any of my luggage survive with me? She starts to reach down.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Ah! He reaches in front of her and picks up his suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And, uh, my attachÃ© case?  86.

dialogues.speaker: MEI LI
dialogues.text: Black attachÃ© case damaged when examined. So sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Apologies quite unnecessary. Bond rises. Mei Li gestures ahead of him. He opens a padd door to the washroom and goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WASHROOM
dialogues.text: Bond shuts the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Sydney is reading a magazine. A red light behind her blin with a beeping sound.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Sydney, tell Mei Li to keep an eye on him. Sydney sets down her magazine, removes her headphones and rises.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WASHROOM
dialogues.text: Bond opens his suitcase and takes out a shaving kit. He s it by the sink. Then he takes out a gray suit on a hanger, He closes the suitcase and reaches up to hang the suit on a hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond notices a wall clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a peephole in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mei Li looks through a peephole in the washroom door.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WASHROOM
dialogues.text: Bond leans back against the wall, then takes his suit and hangs it over the clock.  87.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Mei Li backs away, her view blocked. She moves to a gold portal and opens it, revealing another peephole. She look through it.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WASHROOM
dialogues.text: Bond opens a cabinet mirror and looks behind it. He holds his hand in front of the mirror and sees it thro the back of the mirror. Bond turns, picks up his suitcase and opens it so that th blocks the view through the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Mei Lei backs away, her view blocked again.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WASHROOM
dialogues.text: Bond takes a razor from his shaving kit. He unscrews the handle, drops a mini-Homer device into hi hand and primes it. It beeps. He reaches down, slides bac the heel of his shoe, inserts the device into a slot and closes the heel. Bond rises, shutting his suitcase and picking up a can of shaving cream.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Mei Li looks through the peephole again.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WASHROOM
dialogues.text: Bond has lathered his face. He picks up the shaving cream can, aims it at the mirror and squirts a circle of soap o

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Mei Li backs up, thwarted again, and shuts the portal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane continues flying through clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mei Li dusts a tabletop. Bond emerges from the washroom behind her, wearing a gray suit and vest. DOLLY BACK as h looks ahead at Pussy.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: We'll be landing in twenty minutes. Do you want to play it easy... (she aims a revolver at him) or the hard way? And this isn't a tranquilizer. DOLLY BACK to include Pussy as Bond walks up to her.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Uh, Pussy, you know a lot more about planes than guns. Pussy looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: That's a Smith and Wesson forty- five. If you fire it at this close range, the bullet will pass through me and the fuselage like a blowtorch through butter. The cabin will depressurize and we'll both be sucked into outer space together. (he sits in his swivel chair) But if that's how you want to enter the United States, you're welcome. As for me -- I, uh, prefer the easier way.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: (looking down at him) That's very sensible.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, besides, there's always so much going on around Mister Goldfinger. Oh, I wouldn't dream of not accepting his -- uh, hospitality. Pussy approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: He'll be very glad to see you, too.  89. Bond looks up at her. She rubs the barrel of the revolver under his chin.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: You like close shaves, don't you? She turns away. Bond picks up his snifter and sips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts a book in a bookcase, then hears a voice over his intercom: MISS MONEYPENNY (filtered) Washington, sir, on the green scrambler. "mM" hurries to his desk, flips off the intercom, sits an picks up the phone. oye (into phone) "mM" here. FELIX (over phone) Leiter, sir. oye Leiter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix is on a beige phone. The White House is visible out window behind him.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: It's about double-o-seven, sir. We picked up his Homer signal. It's monitored into Friendship Airport, Baltimore, where he's just landed.

dialogues.speaker: "M" AND FELIX
dialogues.text: oye Baltimore! Nice of him to let us know. Last we heard, he was in Switzerland.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: He came in on a private jet ex Geneva, registered to our old friend Auric Goldfinger.  90. oye I'm glad he's making progress.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. oye Keep an eye on him for us.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Their flight plan gives Blue Grass Field, Kentucky as their final destination. oye Don't charge in on him and spoil anything, will you? He's evidently well on top at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldfinger's jet plane taxis by and approaches a hangar w a sign hanging from the roof reads, "PUSSY GALORE'S FLYIN CIRCUS." On the side of the plane in gold lettering are t words "AURIC ENTERPRISES, INC."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT DOWN to show the plane entering the hangar. Two Kore await in blue jumpsuits and yellow sashes.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HANGAR
dialogues.text: The plane rolls to a stop. The Koreans approach. The cabin door opens. DOLLY BACK as Mei Li starts to lowe the steps.

dialogues.speaker: MEI LI
dialogues.text: Mr. Bond?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: MEI LI
dialogues.text: Please. Bond lowers the steps for her.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Any time.  91.

dialogues.speaker: MEI LI
dialogues.text: Thank you. Mei Li descends the steps. Bond follows. PAN with them. S starts talking to the two Koreans. PAN back to the plane. Pussy descends the steps. A coat hangs over her arm.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (taking her hand) Do mind you step, captain. Pussy pulls back her hand and lifts the coat to reveal sh holds a revolver.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Just keep playing it easy. Bond walks on ahead as Pussy turns to Mei Li. (This time Pussy pronounces her last name "lie" instead of "lee.")

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Mei Li, will you see everything's arranged for Mister Goldfinger?

dialogues.speaker: MEI LI
dialogues.text: Of course. Bond strolls to the entrance to the hangar and looks outs As Pussy approaches him, Bond looks up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY'S FLYING CIRCUS
dialogues.text: Five planes fly in a V-formation. Bond keeps looking up. The planes now fly in a circle. Pussy arrives at Bond's side.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Talented chaps.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: They should be. I trained them. Come on. TRUCK with them as they walk alongside the hangar.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You're a woman of many parts, Pussy. I believe that the bourbon and branch water's rather splendid here in Kentucky. Now that we're off duty, perhaps --  92. Just then Oddjob comes into view, standing beside a red station wagon. Two Koreans sit in the back seat. A blue pickup truck is parked behind it. Oddjob glowers at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oddjob motions to Bond to get in the car. PAN on Bond as walks past him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Manners, Oddjob. JI thought you always took your hat off to a lady. Bond gets in the back seat. Oddjob slams the door shut an opens the driver's door. Mei Li crosses in b.g., walking the station wagon with her two Koreans.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You know, he kills little girls like you. PAN on Pussy as she walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Little boys, too. She bangs twice on the car roof. It drives off. Pussy watches it go then turns aside.

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANES
dialogues.text: The five planes fly across a grass field, coming in for a landing. Pussy steps forward onto a perimeter track. The planes taxi toward her then come to a stop. From one of the planes, a gorgeous blonde pilot (ALTHEA) emerges. PAN on her as she jogs toward Pussy, revealing t other four planes behind her. From them four more BLONDE PILOTS emerge. They all jog over to Pussy. She looks at them with admiration. PAN on the girls as they reach her.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Well?  93.

dialogues.speaker: ALTHEA
dialogues.text: Dress rehearsal went like a dream, skipper.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Good. You'll get your final briefing tonight. That'll be all for now. The girls smile and turn away. Pussy watches them go then turns aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon drives through a gateway onto a stud fa A sign at the entrance reads, "AURIC STUD."

dialogues.speaker: ON A RACE TRACK
dialogues.text: TRACK BACK as two jockeys harness-race along the track. I b.g., the station wagon passes some buildings and horses corral, then stops at a plantation house.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: gets out of the car, followed by Oddjob and the guards. Oddjob motions to Bond to start walking.

dialogues.speaker: AT A STABLE
dialogues.text: Goldfinger, wearing brown suit, yellow cap and brown glov stands on a step looking at a brown horse held by a TRAIN and GROOM. He sees Bond and steps down. PAN on him as he walks over to Bond; the other men lead the horse away in

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Ah! Welcome to Auric Stud, Mister Bond. Lovely animal, isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (glares at him) Certainly better bred than the owner.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (gesturing to Oddjob) Show Mister Bond to his quarters, please. Oddjob and the two guards escort Bond to a staircase that down under a wooden building.  94. Goldfinger watches with a disappointed expression, then t off his gloves and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK BACK as Oddjob and the two guards escort Bond along corridor. The walls are made of stone and there are elabo wooden cross-beams. PAN over to reveal a GUARD opening a heavy metal cell doo There is a small barred window in it. Oddjob takes off hi hat and motions to Bond. Bond steps inside the cell.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CELL
dialogues.text: Bond looks around as the guard closes the door behind him walks over to a grating high in the opposite wall that le a little sunshine and air. Bond reaches down, feels a cot and sits on it, legs cross DOLLY IN as he taps the heel of his shoe.

dialogues.speaker: A GREEN SCOPE
dialogues.text: The indicator light is beeping. Next to it is a Thunderbi logo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another C.I.A. man, Johnnie, sits behind the wheel lookin the scope. The beep indicator is stationary. Felix stands outside the car, leaning against it. It is w with a black convertible top.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNIE
dialogues.text: Felix? Felix gets in the car beside him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNIE
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just drop in on him.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: He'll shout if he needs us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond sits on the cot, his back against the wall, legs ext and arms crossed.  95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kisch walks into Goldfinger's office, seen through the wi Goldfinger sits at a desk.

dialogues.speaker: KISCH
dialogues.text: They're all here, Mister Goldfinger.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Uh?... Oh, yes... yes. (rises and grabs his yellow cap) Thank you, Kisch. Goldfinger exits through a back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four men (CHANCER, MAXIM, LAURENCE and BRAND) sit on an elevated platform as another man -- SOLO -- paces forward wears a black suit and smokes a pipe. TRACK BACK as Solo passes a pool table where three men ar playing (EDWARDS, BRANDON and STRAP).

dialogues.speaker: A BAR
dialogues.text: Three other men sit at the bar (RABIN, MCCARTHY and MIDNI

dialogues.speaker: MCCARTHY
dialogues.text: That guy Solo's gonna wear a hole in shoes. TRACK IN as Solo walks past the bar then stops, hearing a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: A WOODEN HORSE
dialogues.text: HURNDALL laughs as he rides a wooden horse. TRACK BACK to show it is being rocked by BASKERVILLE. Solo stands in b. watching, then turns away. Further back is a central fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: enters the room waving his cap.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Gentlemen! Men all over the room stop what they're doing and look at  96.

dialogues.speaker: MIDNIGHT
dialogues.text: Goldfinger, why weren't we told that New York and the West Coast were in on this?

dialogues.speaker: LAURENCE
dialogues.text: Look who's talking! TRACK BACK on Goldfinger as he walks past Strap and Solo.

dialogues.speaker: STRAP
dialogues.text: I do not do business with Chicago!

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I thought we had a private business deal to settle. Now I find I'm attending a hoods' convention! Goldfinger stops at the pool table.

dialogues.speaker: STRAP
dialogues.text: Goldfinger, I made a delivery. Where is my money?

dialogues.speaker: LAURENCE
dialogues.text: I made a delivery, too.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (leaning on the pool table) You all made the deliveries we contracted for.

dialogues.speaker: MIDNIGHT
dialogues.text: And you owe me one million bucks.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: I owe each of you a million -- in gold bullion.

dialogues.speaker: STRAP
dialogues.text: So pay. Goldfinger rolls a ball across the table.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, you can have the million today... (he picks up another ball then sets it down for emphasis) or ten millions tomorrow!

dialogues.speaker: STRAP
dialogues.text: Did you say ten million?  97.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: AS soon as my bank opens in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Banks don't open on Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: My bank will! Goldfinger laughs. TILT DOWN as he reaches under the pool table and flips a switch. The sound of a motor humming be and the pool table starts moving.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND THE ROOM
dialogues.text: The pool table revolves counter-clockwise and the tableto inverts to reveal a console.

dialogues.speaker: STRAP
dialogues.text: What's with that trick pool table? Goldfinger crosses to the console as the table stops movi and the humming ends. He reaches out and turns three white dials. Indicator lig go on and another humming sound starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large wood panel lowers over the windows.

dialogues.speaker: LAURENCE
dialogues.text: Cover him!

dialogues.speaker: STRAP
dialogues.text: Hey, cover those doors!

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Turn those lights back on! Three gangsters back up in the dark. A large aerial photograph rises from the floor and interi lights go on.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: There is no cause for alarm, gentlemen. He turns a black knob. The humming sound increases. He lo up. The large photograph flattens against the wall as side pa come into place beside it.  98.

dialogues.speaker: LAURENCE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don't like being cooped up like this. -- What's that map doing there? Goldfinger takes a pool cue from a rack by the table. PAN him as he crosses to the aerial photo. It depicts Fort Kn and the surrounding area.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (pointing with the cue) This is my bank. The gold depository at Fort Knox, gentlemen. In its vaults are fifteen billion dollars -- the entire gold supply of the United States.

dialogues.speaker: STRAP
dialogues.text: (laughing) Knock off Fort Knox?! The gangsters laugh at him.

dialogues.speaker: LAURENCE
dialogues.text: Got a key or somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Of a kind. PAN on him as he walks back to the console.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: There are thirty-five thousand troops stationed around there.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (setting down the cue) Forty-one thousand.

dialogues.speaker: MIDNIGHT
dialogues.text: And who's going to say "boo" to them, Goldfinger? Goldfinger turns the white dials again and the humming so resumes. The bar starts to swivel around and the centre of the flo retracts, revealing a hidden model of Fort Knox. The gangsters panic.

dialogues.speaker: MIDNIGHT
dialogues.text: Hey, what's going on here?!

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GANGSTER
dialogues.text: Hey, what is this?!  99.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GANGSTER
dialogues.text: It's the floor!

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GANGSTER
dialogues.text: Say, what is this, a merry-go- round?! The bar swivels into a new position. Goldfinger looks off lighting apparatus lowers from the ceiling above the mode The model starts to rise. The gangsters look at it in amazement. Goldfinger approac the model holding his pool cue.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Man has climbed Mount Everest. Gone to the bottom of the ocean. He has fired rockets to the moon. Split the atom. Achieved Miracles... (the humming stops) in every field of human endeavor -- except crime!

dialogues.speaker: IN BOND'S CELL
dialogues.text: Bond paces to the door. He looks out through the bars. A Korean guard sits outside watching him. Bond waves to him. The guard looks back expressionless. Bond turns, paces to the far end of the cell and returns the bars. The guard sits staring at him. Bond waves to him again an turns away. The guard continues to watch expressionless. Bond paces to the bars again and smiles at the guard. The guard stares back. Bond winks at him. The guard stares ba Bond smiles and suddenly lowers himself below the window. The guard keeps looking. Bond is no longer visible.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARD
dialogues.text: gets up, walks to the door and looks through the bars. Th cell appears empty. He takes out a gun, unlocks the door and kicks it open.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CELL
dialogues.text: The door slams against the inner wall. The guard walks in Bond hides above him in the rafters.  100. The guard looks around, seeing an empty cell.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARD
dialogues.text: Bond, above him, braces himself.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: suddenly jumps down. He grabs the guard from behind. They tussle and fall to the floor. They struggle for the gun. Bond slams the guard's hand against the bed frame and the gun falls. The guard shoves Bond against the wall. Bond kicks him un the chin and the guard falls flat on his back. ZIP PAN over to the gun under the cot. Bond takes the gun his jacket and backs out of the cell as the guard lies unconscious in f.g.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Bond shuts the cell door behind him, lays the key on a pi rags and walks down the corridor putting on his jacket. As he nears the end of the corridor, we see a basement co room ahead containing a hydraulic lift and we hear voices above:

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The underworld will rock with applause for centuries.

dialogues.speaker: MIDNIGHT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Cut the commercial.

dialogues.speaker: STRAP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, get to the point!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RUMPUS ROOM
dialogues.text: Seven of the gangsters are lined up on the platform facin Goldfinger. He holds the pool cue and approaches Solo.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: You're wasting my time, Goldfinger. The depository is impregnable.

dialogues.speaker: STRAP
dialogues.text: (steps forward counting on his fingers) Look, the joint is bomb-proof, electrified, lousy with machine guns, tear gas --  101.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Bear with me, please! Fort Knox is a bank, like any other. Larger, better protected perhaps, but nonetheless a bank! PAN OVER as he points the pool cue at the model.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: It can be, I think the expression is, blown. ZOOM IN on the model. Bond's eyes look out through window the replica of Fort Knox.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: My plan is foolproof, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE MODEL
dialogues.text: Bond stands on the hydraulic platform. He jumps down, loo around, tears a piece of paper from a rolled-up document grabs a pencil. He runs back under the model and looks through it again. Meanwhile we hear Goldfinger continue:

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I call it Operation Grand Slam. I have devoted fifteen years of my life to it. Every detail has been scrupulously prepared. Every eventuality has been considered. We'll operate on a split-second schedule. Your organization, Mister Midnight, brought ina consignment of these canisters...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RUMPUS ROOM
dialogues.text: Goldfinger holds up a gold canister the size of a wine bo

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: across the Canadian border. They contain Delta Nine.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE MODEL
dialogues.text: Bond prepares to write on the piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: MIDNIGHT
dialogues.text: Delta Nine? What's that?  102.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (gesturing emphatically) An invisible nerve gas which disperses fifteen minutes after inducing complete unconsciousness for twenty-four hours! Goldfinger hands the canister to one of the gangsters and paces past them.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Tomorrow at dawn, the Flying Circus of my personal pilot, Miss Pussy Galore...

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ... Will spray it into the atmosphere! Bond starts writing. PAN OVER to the piece of paper. He writes: "Q07 to CIA

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Once the population, including the military, has been immobilized, my task...

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: ... force, which Mr. Strap and his people smuggled across the Rio Grande from Mexico, will approach Fort Knox in motorized equipment along Bullion Boulevard... He points to the model with the pool cue.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: . which runs past the depository here, and intersects with Gold Vault Road. This fence surrounding the depository, as Mister Strap reminded us, is electrified. It will be dynamited. My task force will then move to the main entrance and demolish it.  103.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: How, may I ask?

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: You made that possible, Mister Solo, by arranging, through your considerable influence in shipping circles, to bring through customs uninspected a consignment labeled machine parts. All that will then remain is to descend to the vaults where the bullion is stored.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I've heard enough.

dialogues.speaker: STRAP
dialogues.text: Let him finish.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: (interrupting) If you have no objection... (to Goldfinger) I'll take my money now.

dialogues.speaker: STRAP
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Solo? Too big for you to handle? Goldfinger looks over at other gangsters. They look back him. He looks at another group of gangsters. They look ba Under the model, Bond watches.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, we must respect Mister Solo's decision. Please excuse me for a few minutes while I take care of him. Make yourselves comfortable. Goldfinger leads Solo toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE MODEL
dialogues.text: Bond takes the Homer from his heel, folds the paper aroun and slips it into his pocket. He looks through the model again. He hears general hubbub from the gangsters, and a few clear words:

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANGSTER
dialogues.text: How do we get it out?  104.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GANGSTER
dialogues.text: That's the bit I want to hear.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD GANGSTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, and it had better be good. TILT DOWN to Bond's feet. Suddenly a pair of hands grab h ankles and yank on them. He falls face-down onto the platform. The hands pull him back and hurl him against a wall. He t around and suddenly stops. His assailant is Pussy. She glares at him with her hands her hips.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Pussy! Well, who taught you judo? She holds her hand out. DOLLY BACK as she steps forward; guard crosses behind her.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: The gun you took.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, the gun. The gun, of course. He takes it from his pocket and hands it to her handle-fi She motions to him to go back down the corridor. He start walking. She hands the gun to one of the guards.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: We must have a few fast falls together sometime.

dialogues.speaker: THE BASEMENT CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Kisch steps forward, presses a button and sliding armoure doors glide shut.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BASEMENT CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: DOLLY after Kisch turns to a control panel and switches o t.v. monitors. They show different angles on the rumpus r

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RUMPUS ROOM
dialogues.text: Gangsters hover around the model.

dialogues.speaker: MIDNIGHT
dialogues.text: Hey, Strap, y'know, if he's got the right answers, you and me don't even have to be there. The boys can handle everything.  105.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BASEMENT CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Kisch dons a gas mask. Then he presses a button on a cont panel. Indicator lights go on.

dialogues.speaker: ON ONE OF THE MONITORS
dialogues.text: We see the fireplace hood shut over the grate and some li go off.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RUMPUS ROOMS
dialogues.text: The gangsters react with panic.

dialogues.speaker: GANGSTER
dialogues.text: Hey, they closed up the fireplace! PAN over to the wall-sized photo. A shielding lowers over sealing the room.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GANGSTER
dialogues.text: I don't like this! Four teargas canisters rise from a console table.

dialogues.speaker: MIDNIGHT
dialogues.text: What's goin' on here?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BASEMENT CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Kisch turns a switch.

dialogues.speaker: THE TEARGAS CANISTERS
dialogues.text: DOLLY IN as they start hissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue lights start flashing. The gangsters choke and run around.

dialogues.speaker: MIDNIGHT
dialogues.text: The gas! Gangsters fall to the ground. The canisters keep hissing. The last of the gangsters drop to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Korean guard loads bars of gold into the trunk of a car DOLLY BACK to show it is a Cadillac.  106. Goldfinger and Solo emerge through the front doorway of t house. Another guard follows behind them with a briefcase overcoat.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Such a pity you did not choose to remain with the others, Mister Solo. However... The guard closes the trunk. Solo glances up. Goldfinger notices and looks back. Pussy walks up to them with Bond. Bond takes his hand fro his pocket, holding the piece of paper with the Homer.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Ah, Mister Bond. I thought you were resting in your quarters.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR
dialogues.text: Solo, Goldfinger, Pussy and Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, they are delightful, but it's much too nice to stay indoors. I ran into Miss Galore and she suggested that we join you.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (turning between the two men) Mister Solo, Mister Bond, another of my distinguished guests.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Leaving us so soon, Mister Solo?

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, he has a pressing engagement.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'd like to get started, Goldfinger. He calls behind him to the guard.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Boy!  107. Solo approaches the car followed by the guard.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Ah, when you gotta go, you gotta go. Solo opens the passenger door. Bond slips the paper into pocket.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: My plane will get you to New York on time. With you excess luggage. (he laughs) Solo takes the briefcase and overcoat from the guard and into the car.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (closing the door) Allow me. Oddjob approaches from b.g.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: My chauffeur's an excellent driver. You will be at the airport in a few minutes. Oddjob gets in behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Mister Solo. Some other time, perhaps...

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (leaning forward) Happy landings, old boy. PAN on the car as it drives off.

dialogues.speaker: THREE -SHOT
dialogues.text: Goldfinger, Pussy and Bond.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: I found him under the model. Goldfinger looks at Bond. Bond looks back.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Operation Grand Slam. I did enjoy your briefing.  108. Goldfinger looks back at Bond. Bond looks back at Goldfin

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (grins slightly) So did I. PAN on him as he walks off. Bond and Pussy watch him go. Goldfinger heads for the stables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN on Oddjob's Cadillac as it drives by.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE COLONEL SANDERS'
dialogues.text: Johnnie again sits in the driver's seat of the Thunderbir He hears the scope beeping and looks at it. The beep indicator is moving. He gets out of the car and honks the horn. Felix hurries of the restaurant eating.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNIE
dialogues.text: He's on the move! Felix takes another bite and heads for the car. Johnnie backs the car up. Felix rushes into the passenger seat and they take off.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: turns a corner at "Joe's Drive-In" and heads up another street.

dialogues.speaker: THE THUNDERBIRD
dialogues.text: follows up the same street.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE THUNDERBIRD
dialogues.text: Felix looks at the scope. The beep indicator moves upward

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Slow down. Don't crowd him. The Thunderbird keeps following.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: cruises along. Solo sits impassively in the back seat as Oddjob drives.  109. The Cadillac passes under bridge where a sign reads, "INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT." Then it passes a Sign at the sid the road that reads, "AIRPORT."

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: (looking back) Are you blind or something? You missed the turn! Oddjob looks purposefully ahead.

dialogues.speaker: ON A SIDE ROAD
dialogues.text: The Cadillac rounds a corner. It stops at the side of the road. Solo, puzzled, looks back. Oddjob picks up a pistol with a silencer and aims it at h Solo looks forward again and sees the gun. His eyes open in shock. Oddjob shoots him in the chest. Solo falls back against h seat then drops out of view. Oddjob peers down at him smugly.

dialogues.speaker: THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: drives forward again.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE THUNDERBIRD
dialogues.text: Felix studies the scope.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Hmm. He turned to the right just ahead here somewhere. The Thunderbird stops, backs up and heads in a different direction.

dialogues.speaker: ODDJOB
dialogues.text: drives serenely.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Cadillac races by under a bridge.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE THUNDERBIRD
dialogues.text: The beeping continues.  110.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNIE
dialogues.text: (glancing at the scope) Where's this old pal of yours heading?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Ten'll get you one, it's a drink or a dame. Johnnie looks at him and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Thunderbird continues under the same bridge.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Oddjob keeps driving serenely.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: He turns into a scrap yard where scrap metal is piled int pyramids . A sign on the wall reads, "ATLANTIC IRON & MET

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SCRAP YARD
dialogues.text: Oddjob pulls to a stop, gets out of the Cadillac and walk away. Just then grab hooks descend onto the car. They surround roof, gripping the car, and raise it into the air. The hooks swing the car overhead then drop it into a car- crushing machine. The flanges of the machine start to clo on the car.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: The machine's hydraulics compress the car into a foot-squ cube. The flanges retract and a gateway opens. A metal arm push the cube out through the gateway. An electromagnet snags the cube from above. It lifts the into the air then lowers it into the back of Oddjob's blu pickup truck as Oddjob (looking thinner) approaches the t Oddjob gets in behind the wheel and glances back as the c is lowered into place. Oddjob drives away.  111.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE THUNDERBIRD
dialogues.text: Felix tries adjusting the controls of the scope but the beeping has stopped.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNIE
dialogues.text: Mechanical failure maybe.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Unless he switched it off. Felix keeps trying to adjust the scope.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNIE
dialogues.text: Why would he do that?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Drive to the farm. It's all we can do.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNIE
dialogues.text: Right. PAN on the Thunderbird as it drives on. Then the pickup t comes down the other side of the road. PAN on it into the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pussy sits at a table with Goldfinger. A SERVANT sets min juleps in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Thank you. The servant moves off. DOLLY in to a tighter two-shot of Pussy and Goldfinger.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Your share of Operation Grand Slam will make you a very rich woman, my dear.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Why else would I be in it, Mister Goldfinger? She reaches for her glass. He strokes her hand.  112.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: You'll retire to England, I suppose? He continues stroking her hand.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: No. I've spotted a little island in the Bahamas. I'll hang up a sign -- She takes the glass, rejecting Goldfinger's hand.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: -- no trespassing, and go back to nature. Goldfinger taps the tabletop, acknowledging the rejection

dialogues.speaker: THREE -SHOT
dialogues.text: Pussy, Goldfinger and Kisch. Kisch walks up to them.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Yes, Kisch?

dialogues.speaker: KISCH
dialogues.text: Two men in a car, with binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Touts looking for racing tips.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE FARM
dialogues.text: Felix and Johnnie stand at a fence, the Thunderbird parke behind them. Felix hands Johnnie a pair of binoculars. Fe looks through them.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: starts thinking.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: There is another possibility, however. Kisch, ask Mister Bond to join us. Kisch walks off. DOLLY IN on Pussy and Goldfinger.  113.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (to Pussy) We were quite right to spare Mister Bond's life in Switzerland. If those gentlemen are his friends, let us convince them he needs no assistance. For their benefit, Pussy, let's make him as happy as possible. I suggest you change into something more suitable.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Certainly. (sets her glass down) Business before pleasure. He chortles. She gets up. Her chortles again as he watche her go, then turns to his drink.

dialogues.speaker: IN BOND'S CELL
dialogues.text: Bond sits on the cot, his back against the wall and legs V-position, wearing his suit. DOLLY BACK and PAN OVER to reveal three guards watching him. Kisch appears in the doorway and gestures to Bond with a

dialogues.speaker: KISCH
dialogues.text: He wants you. Bond gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix and Johnnie stand looking over the fence, Felix wit binoculars. He pans over, seeing something.

dialogues.speaker: THE PORCH OF THE PLANTATION HOUSE
dialogues.text: Kisch follows Bond to the porch where Goldfinger still si the table.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (casually, gesturing) Ah, Mister Bond. Sit down, please. A mint julep? Traditional, but satisfying.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes, thanks. (to the servant) Sour mash, but not too sweet, please.  114. The servant nods and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (slips his hands in his pockets) You disappoint me, Goldfinger. You know Operation Grand Slam simply won't work. Incidentally, Delta Nine nerve gas is fatal.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: You are unusually well informed, Mr. Bond. The servant approaches with Bond's drink on a tray.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You'll kill sixty-thousand people uselessly. (to servant) Ah! He takes his drink. The servant moves off. Kisch, though, lingers behind them.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: American motorists kill that many every two years.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes, well, I've worked out a few statistics of my own. (sits across the table from him) Fifteen billion dollars in gold bullion weighs ten thousand, five hundred tons. Sixty men would take twelve days to load it onto two hundred trucks. Now, at the most, you're going to have two hours before the army, navy, air force, marines move in and make you put it back.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Who mentioned anything about removing it? Bond stops drinking. Kisch leans back against a pillar be them, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the julep tart enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (thinking) You plan to break into the world's largest bank, but not to steal anything. Why?

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Go on, Mister Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Mister Ling, the Red Chinese agent at the factory. He's a specialist in nuclear fission. -- But of course! Goldfinger smiles back at him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: His government's given you a bomb!

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: I prefer to call it an atomic device. It's small, but particularly dirty.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Cobalt and iodine?

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Precisely.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, if you explode it in Fort Knox, the, uh, entire gold supply of the United States will be radioactive for... fifty-seven years!

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Fifty-eight, to be exact.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I apologize, Goldfinger. It's an inspired deal. They get what they want -- economic chaos in the West -- and the value of your gold increases many times.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: I conservatively estimate ten times. 115.  116.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Brilliant. But the atomic device, as you call it, is already, obviously in this country.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Obviously.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: But bringing it to Fort Knox, uh, undetected could be risky -- very risky.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Oh the contrary, Mister Bond. The risk is all on your side. If the authorities should attempt to locate it, who knows where it might be exploded, eh? Perhaps the Polaris submarine pens at New London, Cape Kennedy, near the White House... But we are speculating idly. Operation Grand Slam will be successful. You will be there to see for yourself -- to closely for comfort, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond looks off. He sees the blue pickup truck returning. truck stops in front of the house. Goldfinger approaches it, followed by Bond.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Mister Bond, but, uh, I must arrange to separate my gold from the late Mister Solo. Goldfinger approaches the pickup truck.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: As you said he had a pressing engagement. As Goldfinger reaches the back of the truck, Pussy emerge through the front door of the house wearing casual clothe

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Ah, very chic, Miss Galore. (to Bond) Don't you agree? Please entertain Mister Bond for me, Pussy. I'll join you both later.  117. He bangs on the back of the truck and walks off with it. Pussy crosses behind Bond and links an arm through his.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Well, how about it, handsome? Don't you think it's about time we got to know each other socially?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, the new Miss Galore. Where do you hide you gold knuckles in this outfit?

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: (escorting him forward) Oh, uh, I never carry weapons after business hours.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yeah? So you're off duty.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: I'm completely defenseless.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (looking at her) So am I. Pussy laughs.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FENCE
dialogues.text: Felix continues looking through the binoculars, Johnnie b him.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: Bond and Pussy walk casually across the grounds toward a stable.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: lowers the binoculars and passes them to Johnnie.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: That's my James.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: They walk past the stable, her arm still linked through h

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Beautiful place Goldfinger has here.  118.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm glad you're enjoying it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Too bad it all has to end tomorrow morning. He faces Pussy. She looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: He's quite mad, you know. Pussy keeps looking at him. Bond turns to the entrance to the stable.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, now. What do we have here? He walks inside, Pussy following.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FENCE
dialogues.text: Felix looks through the binoculars again.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Double-o-seven seems to have the situation well in hand. Come on, I'm bushed. Let's get back to the motel. They turn away toward the Thunderbird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond paces in front of Pussy.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You're quite a girl, Pussy.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: I'm strictly the outdoor type.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'd like to think you're not in on all of this, uh, caper.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Skip it. I'm not interested. Let's go. He grabs her arm and turns her back.  119.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: What would it take for you to see things my way?

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: A lot more than you've got.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (looking into her eyes) How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: (looking back) I don't want to know. She turns to the door again. He grabs her and holds her b

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Isn't it customary to grant the condemned man his last request?

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: You've asked for this. She hurls him with a Judo move. He summersaults and lands his butt in hay. He looks back at her. She exhales. Pussy walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: Get up! Bond grabs her leg and drops her into the hay.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (rising) Certainly. He offers a hand to help her up. She rises. She tries to throw him but he twists her around and tosses her over hi back. She lands in the hay. She recovers and looks back, glaring. Bond smiles, walks toward her and sits beside her.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: There. Now let's both play. She tries to kick him but he jumps on top of her. She pla her hands at his throat, trying to push him away, but he steadily lowers himself. She turns her head to the side.  120. Bond's mouth comes down on hers and they kiss. Struggling first, Pussy finally relents and lets him kiss her. Her h move from his neck to his shoulders, then the flings her around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An airplane's propellers rev up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Korean guard check the gas canister mounted under the w of one of the planes. He runs to the other wing and check the canister there as well. Another guard in b.g. looks under the wing of another pla (but there are no canisters there).

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Pussy Galore to Champagne leader. Commence Rock-a-Bye Baby. Good luck. The guards back away. PAN on the five planes as they taxi down a runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN on the planes as they take off.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SKY
dialogues.text: The planes fly in V-formation.

dialogues.speaker: IN ONE OF THE PLANES
dialogues.text: DENISE is flying and talks into her mic.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Speed two-two-o. Wind check westerly.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIVE PLANES
dialogues.text: fly across the sky.  121.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: looking pleased, glances down at her controls.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE PLANES
dialogues.text: They fly over green terrain.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: talks into her mic.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Champagne leader to Champagne section. Commence dive -- now.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE PLANES
dialogues.text: They fly in V-formation over a forest approaching Fort Kn extreme b.g.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: talks into her mic again.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: Ready for Rock-a-Bye Baby. Commence spray on countdown. Five...

dialogues.speaker: IN ANOTHER PLANE
dialogues.text: MAGGIE is at her controls.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: four...

dialogues.speaker: IN ANOTHER PLANE
dialogues.text: LESLEY is at her controls.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE'S VOICE
dialogues.text: three...

dialogues.speaker: IN ANOTHER PLANE
dialogues.text: JANE is at the controls.

dialogues.speaker: IN DENISE'S PLANE
dialogues.text: She speaks the final word into the mic.

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: zero.

dialogues.speaker: THE CANISTERS UNDER HER WING
dialogues.text: begin to spray smoky gas.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING THE PLANES
dialogues.text: They continue flying in V-formation right over Fort Knox.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND
dialogues.text: The planes continue over Fort Knox and separate from formation.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER A WING
dialogues.text: Smoky gas continues to shoot from a canister.

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANES
dialogues.text: fly off in different directions.

dialogues.speaker: IN ONE OF THE PLANES
dialogues.text: Jane sits at the controls, looking over.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND
dialogues.text: pass over planes sitting on a tarmac and various building PAN on them to reveal a sign on a brick building that rea

dialogues.speaker: PLANE'S POV
dialogues.text: We pass over barracks approaching two water towers.

dialogues.speaker: IN A PLANE
dialogues.text: Denise at the controls looks down.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER TOWERS
dialogues.text: She begins flying past them.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND
dialogues.text: She continues past them.  123.

dialogues.speaker: PLANE'S POV
dialogues.text: More barracks approach.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE WING
dialogues.text: Smoky gas shoots out from the canisters as the plane cros the barracks.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: A phalanx of marching men suddenly fall to the ground as plane passes over the barracks beside them.

dialogues.speaker: A PLANE
dialogues.text: flies over other roofs.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Another phalanx of marching men fall.

dialogues.speaker: THE WING OF ANOTHER PLANE
dialogues.text: More white smoke shoots from the canisters as the plane f over more barracks then crosses a tall building.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Leslie is at the controls.

dialogues.speaker: A PARADE GROUND
dialogues.text: A number of soldiers stand grouped together as she approa

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: A group of men collapse.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE WING
dialogues.text: The plane continues spraying gas as it passes overhead.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: A group of soldiers on a trestle bench fall unconscious. another group of men collapse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane angles up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: LESLIE
dialogues.text: looks down.  124.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes over rows of battle tanks.

dialogues.speaker: AT A HANGER
dialogues.text: more soldiers drop to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Another plane flies over another row of tanks and the sol there collapse, then the plane circles overhead. It passe the roofs of buildings.
