dialogues.speaker: IN THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Denise looks down.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Two planes pass overhead and more soldiers fall to the gr

dialogues.speaker: ON A TARMAC
dialogues.text: A plane passes over another group of soldiers. They colla

dialogues.speaker: A PLANE
dialogues.text: flies over a building.

dialogues.speaker: ON ANOTHER FIELD
dialogues.text: A group of soldiers in f.g. collapse. Then a row of soldi behind them doing calisthenics drop to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: The plane rises from the soldiers into the air.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PLANE
dialogues.text: flies over a rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Denise looks down, another plane visible in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: THE MILITARY BASE
dialogues.text: The buildings appear deserted.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - A group of soldiers lie collapsed on the ground.  125. - Another group of soldiers lie collapsed in a jeep. - Another group of soldiers lie collapsed in a street. - Another group of soldiers lie collapsed near trucks. - Another group of soldiers lie collapsed near buildings. TILT DOWN to even more collapsed soldiers on grass nearby

dialogues.speaker: DENISE
dialogues.text: (into her mic) Champagne leader to Grand Slam task force leader. The baby is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A convoy awaits -- three trucks, a jeep and an ambulance. DENISE (0.S., filtered) I repeat: the baby is asleep. We're going home now.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE JEEP
dialogues.text: DOLLY BACK past two Koreans inside to reveal Kisch blowin whistle. The Koreans wear their blue jumpsuits and yellow sashes; Kisch wears green army fatigues.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND A TRUCK
dialogues.text: Bond sits in back wearing a black suit. He is handcuffed Oddjob. Oddjob tosses him a gas mask.

dialogues.speaker: ODDJOB
dialogues.text: Argh! Bond catches it and Oddjob climbs in beside him.

dialogues.speaker: KISCH
dialogues.text: puts on a gas mask and gets into the jeep.

dialogues.speaker: THE TASK FORCE
dialogues.text: The vehicles take off, the jeep in the lead.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONVOY
dialogues.text: PAN as they turn a corner to reveal two crashed cars. One overturned and from the other a man's body leans out.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER STREET
dialogues.text: The convoy heads up the street and passes soldiers lying the ground and others lying in a jeep.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONVOY
dialogues.text: rounds another corner. PAN on them as they pass more sold lying on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy rounds another corner. Ahead lays Fort Knox. A green car rests in a ditch at the side of the road and Felix' head is visible leaning dead out a rear window. Johnnie lies beside him.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE JEEP
dialogues.text: Kisch and the other two men in gas masks look to the side

dialogues.speaker: FORT KNOX
dialogues.text: As they approach it they see an overturned truck and many soldiers lying at the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE JEEP
dialogues.text: Kisch looks ahead.

dialogues.speaker: FORT KNOX
dialogues.text: comes closer. More soldiers lie in another jeep at the ot side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND
dialogues.text: approaches the gate. Bond and Oddjob are in the bed of th last truck. PAN over to the green car in the ditch and ZO IN on Felix, lying still.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE GATE
dialogues.text: The convoy passes a sign that reads "STOP AT RED SIGNAL." halts at the gate to Fort Knox. Kisch alights from the je One of the Koreans hands him a wooden box.  127. Kisch opens it. Inside is a measuring device with a meter registering "TOXIC UNITS PER CC X100" and a label that sa "AURIC SPECTROMETER." The needle is at zero. Kisch gives the box back to the Korean.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST TRUCK
dialogues.text: A tarpaulin is raised, revealing a dozen guards in gas ma Kisch pulls off his mask and blows his whistle.

dialogues.speaker: THE LAST TRUCK
dialogues.text: Oddjob removes his mask and gestures to Bond to do the sa

dialogues.speaker: AT THE GATE
dialogues.text: Guards from the first truck carry explosive cylinders to gate. They lay them at the base of the gate. A guard attaches a wire to the explosives as Kisch looks The guard runs back to the jeep unspooling the wire. Anot guard attaches it to a detonator and turns the handle. The gate explodes, sending pieces flying. Bond looks back at the explosion. The jeep drives through the gateway.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUNDS OF FORT KNOX
dialogues.text: The jeep, followed by the trucks, turns down a circular d that runs past the fort. PAN over to the front entrance, where lettering over the doorway reads "UNITED STATES

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SIDE OF THE FORT
dialogues.text: The ambulance pulls to one side, its back to the deposito as the other vehicles take positions nearby. Two guards open a panel on the side of the ambulance, revealing control switches. They back away as Kisch walks and turns a dial. The top of the ambulance opens up. DOLLY IN as a laser gu rises from inside the ambulance, pointing at the fort. Tw guards ride the lift up with it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND ODDJOB
dialogues.text: alight from the back of the truck.  128.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SIDE OF THE FORT
dialogues.text: Kisch signals to the ambulance driver.

dialogues.speaker: KISCH
dialogues.text: Chafoo! The ambulance backs up to the side door of the fort. Bond Oddjob stand nearby. The guards activate the laser, sending a red beam into th of the door. Bond and Oddjob step closer and watch. The b starts cutting across the top of the door. The guards aim it further along. Kisch watches. The beam keeps cutting. The guards aim it further to the side. Bond and Oddjob wa The beam reaches the other end of the door. Kisch signals to four guards with a chain. Two of them at it to the back of the ambulance and the other two run to fort's door A guard turns the laser off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door falls to the floor and is dragged away by the ambulance. Kisch enters and moves to another door as guar run past him. Two guards take a trolley; another runs upstairs to a con room; another poses with a machine gun. The guards with t trolley run outside with it as Kisch presses a button and opens another door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of collapsed soldiers lie in a jeep in f.g. asa helicopter flies across the fort. Bond and Oddjob look up it.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SIDE OF THE FORT
dialogues.text: The helicopter passes over the building.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RECEPTION AREA
dialogues.text: Through the open doors we see the helicopter come in for landing.  129.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE FORT
dialogues.text: Bond and Oddjob watch the chopper land. Goldfinger emerges from the chopper wearing a brown overc and a scarf, followed by Ling carrying a small box. Pussy in the pilot's seat, all in white. Goldfinger walks up to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mister Bond. For once you are exactly where I want you. Bond looks over at Pussy. She looks back at him, concerne then ahead at the fort. Guard push the trolley away from the chopper. The trolley bears a large silver cabinet. DOLLY BACK as the guards wheel it into the reception area other guards who man the doorway. Bond, Goldfinger, Oddjo Kisch and Ling follow. Ling unlocks the top of the cabine and gestures to the guards. Two guards open the top of the cabinet, revealing shieldi and controls. Ling sets his box on the shielding. Bond, Goldfinger and Oddjob look on. Ling takes a primer from the box and places it in a slot the controls. Goldfinger signals up to the control room. A guard nods, turns to a switchboard and looks down through a viewer.

dialogues.speaker: THE COMBINATION LOCK
dialogues.text: There are two rows of numbers. The top row reads "92255." The bottom row reads "10085." Both change to "36104."

dialogues.speaker: THE VAULT DOOR
dialogues.text: a round door with a handle in the middle begins to open. Bond and Oddjob look on. The door swings all the way open, revealing a gantry and stairs inside. Flooring slides into place at the base of entryway.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOMB
dialogues.text: Ling turns a control dial then turns a key and removes it the primer. The device begins emitting a rhythmic humming  130. Goldfinger, looking on with Bond and Oddjob, checks his w and winds it. Guards close the top of the cabinet and Ling locks the to ZOOM IN to a timer beside the controls that starts counti down from "354."

dialogues.speaker: AN OSCILLOSCOPE
dialogues.text: The scope begins oscillating with a wave signal sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Felix opens his eyes and rises. DOLLY BACK to reveal a SCIENTIST in glasses in the rear.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: The bomb's here.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Let's get moving, brigadier. A BRIGADIER GENERAL rises in the passenger seat and a LT. COLONEL rises in the driver seat.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGADIER
dialogues.text: Right, Jack. Move in.

dialogues.speaker: LT. COLONEL
dialogues.text: (into a phone) Move in, commando tactics. PAN OVER to reveal Fort Knox down the road. The soldiers were lying "dead" get up. A SOLDIER crouches just outside Felix' car speaking into a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGADIER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Minimum offensive fire until I signal bomb has been neutralized.

dialogues.speaker: BRIGADIER
dialogues.text: Come on! The men jump out as the Lt. Colonel remains on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: LT. COLONEL
dialogues.text: (on phone) Minimum offensive fire until I signal bomb has been neutralized. Bomb disposal unit to accompany

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards move the trolley in across a bridge. Bond and Oddj follow.

dialogues.speaker: THE VAULT
dialogues.text: It is a four-story tall cathedral of gold. Stairs lead do from each level. Gold bars are stacked in gigantic barred cages. Guards move the trolley to a lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond, Oddjob and Goldfinger walk up to the trolley. Kisch unlocks the handcuffs from Oddjob's wrist. Meanwhile, Goldfinger looks hungrily to the side. TILT DO stacks of gold bars in a cage. Goldfinger looks up at Bon again. Kisch attaches the handcuffs to the trolley, then he and Oddjob walk away.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: (with a slight bow) Goodbye, Mister Bond. He signals to Kisch, who presses a button on the lift.

dialogues.speaker: THE LIFT
dialogues.text: descends with Bond on it. ZOOM BACK to an extreme wide sh of the vault as Bond approaches ground level. Goldfinger turns away, leaving Oddjob at the lift doors looking down. The lift arrives at ground level. Bond looks at the timer It counts from "256" to "254." He reaches for the control panel.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RECEPTION AREA
dialogues.text: Goldfinger exits the vault and walks over to Ling.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: Mister Ling, it is merely a matter of timing and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Army soldiers grab some of Goldfinger's guards from behin Other guards fire machines guns back at them.  132.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RECEPTION AREA
dialogues.text: Guards back into the area firing guns. Goldfinger suddenl runs up the stairs to the control room.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Goldfinger looks into the viewer and starts turning dials scrambling the combination to the vault.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING INTO THE VAULT
dialogues.text: The door starts to close. Oddjob and Kisch are in b.g. Kisch sees the door moving and runs for it. The door clos on him.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Goldfinger pulls off his overcoat and scarf, revealing an officer's uniform underneath. He puts on a green cap.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Pussy looks at the fighting and reaches for the controls

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Goldfinger straightens his green cap, pulls a gold revolv from inside his coat and runs from the room.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RECEPTION AREA
dialogues.text: Goldfinger runs down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: LING
dialogues.text: (calling to him) Goldfinger! Just then three soldiers outside the doorway with machine and shoot a guard. Ling yells helplessly to Goldfinger in Chinese. Goldfinge shoots him. Ling falls dead to the floor. Four soldiers run in. Goldfinger hurries to them, pointin Ling.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: He's one of them! So's the girl! I'll get her, you get the door open! The soldiers move forward. Goldfinger picks up a machine from a fallen guard and shoots them all in the back.  133. They all fall to the floor dead. Goldfinger sets down the machine gun, picks up his gold revolver and runs outside. explosion goes off just beyond the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VAULT
dialogues.text: Bond struggles to lift the cover of the container.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Kisch pushes and knocks on it, then turns to Oddjob.

dialogues.speaker: KISCH
dialogues.text: We're trapped. Oddjob steps back from the lift doors and turns to face h

dialogues.speaker: KISCH
dialogues.text: The bomb. I'll take the fuse out. Kisch runs for the lift. Oddjob blocks him and grabs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: KISCH
dialogues.text: Don't be a fool! You can be a hero. I'm not. Kisch breaks away and runs around the far corner of the walkway. Oddjob chases him.

dialogues.speaker: IN A CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Oddjob catches up to Kisch and grabs him near a railing. Kisch screams.

dialogues.speaker: KISCH
dialogues.text: No! No! Bond looks up. Oddjob hurls Kisch over the railing, sending his body somersaulting down. Bond hears the crash of the body on the floor. He looks around the corner of the lift. He sees Oddjob up above looking down. Then he looks down.

dialogues.speaker: KISCH'S BODY
dialogues.text: lies atop bars covering a cage in the floor. ZOOM IN to Kisch's shirt pocket. It bulges slightly from a key insid  134.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks up again at Oddjob, who looks down at him. Then Bon grabs the trolley and starts moving it toward Kisch's bod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond moves the trolley around the corner of the lift.

dialogues.speaker: ODDJOB
dialogues.text: four stories above sees what he's doing and starts to run

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - DOLLY BACK as Bond pulls the trolley closer to Kisch. H looks up. - Oddjob runs down a flight of stairs, reaches a landing rounds a corner. Directly below is Bond with the trolley, arriving at the bars to the floor-cage. - Bond steps onto a bar and reaches down for Kisch's pock - Oddjob rounds another landing. - Bond reaches closer to Kisch's pocket. - Oddjob stops on the next landing and looks at him, then keeps running. - Bond pulls a key from Kisch's pocket. He hears Oddjob's approaching footsteps and glances up, then PAN ON HIM as jumps back to the trolley and puts the key in the handcuf - EXTREME WIDE ANGLE: Oddjob reaches the last landing. - He takes off his bowler hat. - Bond looks up at him. - Oddjob hurls the hat. It whooshes through the air. Bond ducks and the hat passes just over his head, landing the bars of the floor-cage. Bond looks back at Oddjob. - Oddjob climbs over the railing at the landing. - Bond turns the key in the handcuffs. - Oddjob jumps down to the floor and starts to run. - Bond unlocks the handcuffs and darts the other way.  135. - EXTREME WIDE ANGLE: Bond runs toward a barred cage in t back wall as Oddjob runs after him. - Oddjob stops near the lift and picks up his hat. PAN on as he crosses to the other side of the lift and looks at who backs up almost against the cage. There is a blue mechanized dolly bearing gold bars between Oddjob and Bon Oddjob aims the hat at Bond and throws it. - The hat sails high and severs a heavy electrical cable, sending down a cascade of sparks. - Bond looks up at the sparks as the cable falls. - The cable lands on the floor next to the hat, still sho sparks. - Bond looks up at Oddjob. - Oddjob straightens himself. - Bond grabs a gold bar from the dolly and hurls it at hi - The bar bounces harmlessly off Oddjob's chest and falls the floor. - Bond looks in surprise, almost admiration, at Oddjob, a darts off to the side. - The timer on the bomb goes from "216" to "213." - PAN on Oddjob as he approaches Bond. Bond positions him in a stance for a fight. Bond jumps at Oddjob and throws arms around Oddjob's neck. - CLOSER ANGLE: As Bond clings to Oddjob's neck, Oddjob p him up like a doll. - WIDER ANGLE: Oddjob throws him against the wall. - CLOSER ANGLE: Bond lands on the floor beside a trolley loaded with gold bars. He finds a large wooden staff behi the trolley and picks it up. - WIDER ANGLE: Bond angles the staff at Oddjob. Oddjob ba up. - CLOSER ANGLE: Bond lunges at him with it. Oddjob dodges from it and the end of the staff hits the wall. Oddjob ju chops right through it, breaking it in two. Bond keeps hi fist around the smaller half. - Oddjob smiles at Bond.  136. - Bond smashes him in the face with the broken staff. Oddjob's head barely turns. - Oddjob looks back at him grinning. - Bond tries to smash Oddjob in the face again. - Oddjob grabs his arm. - Oddjob slams him against the wall. - WIDER ANGLE: Oddjob throws him sliding across the floor moves to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Korean guards in the entryway fire machine guns at U.S. troops outside. A number of soldiers fall. - The guards run back into the reception area. - The soldiers run to the entryway and start to fire insi PAN over to show the guards falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Bond slides on his back along the floor, landing near another mechanized dolly loaded with gold bars. - WIDER ANGLE: Bond grabs a metal lever on the dolly as Oddjob watches in f.g. - CLOSER ANGLE: Bond pulls off the lever. - PAN on Oddjob as he positions himself to face him. - Bond approaches him, raising the lever, and swings it a head. Oddjob ducks, avoiding it. Bond raises the lever again. Oddjob grabs his arm and squeezes it and the lever drops. Then Oddjob grabs Bond under the arm. - WIDER ANGLE: Oddjob hurls him past the bomb. - Bond lands against the wall of the lift. - The timer ticks down from "147" to "145." - Oddjob grabs Bond again and throws him toward the side Bond falls. - Bond rolls over near a cage in the wall then rises. Odd lunges at him. Bond grabs Oddjob's arm in a judo hold and thrusts him toward the wall.  137. - CLOSER ANGLE: Bond presses Oddjob's shoulder against th wall but without effect. Oddjob replies with a judo-chop Bond's lower back. Bond gasps and releases his grip and Oddjob flings him backwards. - Bond lands against the cage in the side wall, breathles He sinks down against the bars breathing heavily. - Oddjob rises and smiles at him again. - Bond looks back exhausted. - Oddjob brings down another judo-chop. - His hand strikes Bond in the side. Bond doubles over. Oddjob grabs him around the neck and throws him at the ba wall. - Bond falls and slides toward the hat and smoldering cab - Bond comes to a stop, the hat right in front of him. Bo raises himself onto his elbow and looks up. - Oddjob approaches him. - Bond stares back. - The timer ticks down from "127" to "125." - Oddjob stops and gestures to Bond to get up. - Bond looks down at the hat and grabs it. - Oddjob suddenly looks concerned and takes a step back. - Bond rises with the hat. - PAN ON Oddjob as he stealthily backs to the side. - POV FROM INSIDE THE CAGE: Bond circles in front of Oddj who keeps backing away. - Oddjob backs up further toward the cage. - Bond moves forward with the hat. - Oddjob backs further away; the cage bars are now right behind him. - Bond hurls the hat at him. - Oddjob ducks. The hat sails past him and lodges between bars with a clang. Oddjob looks back at it.  138. - Bond looks at Oddjob. - Oddjob smiles back. - Bond keeps looking at Oddjob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Oddjob turns to get his hat. - Bond looks down. - WIDER ANGLE: Bond suddenly dives and grabs the broken c as Oddjob reaches for his hat. - Oddjob grips the hat. - Bond touches the cable to a cage bar. - Oddjob screams as sparks fly from the hat and there is sizzling sound. - WIDER ANGLE: The sparks keep flying. Oddjob, still hold the hat, falls back against the cage bars as Bond keeps holding the cable against the bar, electrocuting him. - Bond rubs the cable against the bar. - LOW ANGLE: Oddjob falls forward and lands on his chest Bond watches from b.g. - Bond looks at Oddjob's body then jumps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOMB
dialogues.text: Bond runs to the trolley and looks at the timer. It ticks down from "059" to "054." Bond slaps the cabinet's lid an looks about him, then down at where Kisch lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - In the entryway, American troops continue to fire. - More Korean guards fall dead. The corpse of an Army sol lies among them.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VAULT
dialogues.text: Bond reaches into the cage behind Kisch's body and takes gold ingots. He steps back to the bomb, puts an ingot on the lid and bangs on its underside. The lid stays locked. Bond turns into a different position.  139.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond places an ingot under the lid and hammers on it from below with the other.

dialogues.speaker: THE TIMER
dialogues.text: clicks down from "049" to "047."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korean guards in f.g. fire at the entryway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soldier runs past the entryway lobbing a hand grenade i es other soldiers run behind him. The grenade explodes in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SOLDIER runs in and mounts the stairs to the control ro

dialogues.speaker: KOREANS
dialogues.text: They fire at him.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: The soldier dives into the control room.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: The soldier quickly turns dials on the control panel.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE VIEWER
dialogues.text: The top row of numbers stays at "36104" while the bottom changes from "76755" to "36104."

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARDS
dialogues.text: The vault door swings open as the guards keep firing mach guns. It shoves one of the guards against a railing.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAILING
dialogues.text: The door crushes the guard against it.

dialogues.speaker: THE VAULT DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Korean guards back into the vault firing their machine gu ahead of them.  140.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: still banging on the ingot looks up at the battle.

dialogues.speaker: A CATWALK
dialogues.text: A gunshot drops a Korean guard dead.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE CATWALK
dialogues.text: Other Korean guards run down a side walkway. A gunshot so and one of them falls dead with a scream.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks up again then down at the counter. It drops from "0 to "036." He bangs again on the underside of the lid.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RECEPTION AREA
dialogues.text: Soldiers firing rifles pass through the entrance to the v

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VAULT
dialogues.text: Soldiers run inside as guards flee them into b.g.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: bangs again on the underside of the lid. He hears more gunfire and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOP GALLERY
dialogues.text: A Korean guard clutches his stomach and falls over the railing, somersaulting four levels to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: A LANDING BEHIND BOND
dialogues.text: As Bond pounds on the lid again, a guard stops on a landi above him and aims a pistol at him.

dialogues.speaker: AT A RAILING
dialogues.text: A soldier fires a machine gun at the guard.

dialogues.speaker: OVER THE SOLDIER'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: The guard falls over the railing to the floor, and anothe guard drops dead on a catwalk behind him.  141.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: smashes the underside of the lid again. It pops open, the lock broken! Bond reaches for the lid to raise it and gla at the counter. The counter drops from "032" to "030." Bond throws back the lid. DOLLY IN on the bomb as he open the inner casing to reveal a mechanism with spinning whee and gears.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: - DOLLY IN on him as he looks down at the contraption, clueless as to what to do. He looks at the timer. - The timer drops from "026" to "024." - Bond keeps looking down. - BOND'S POV - THE MACHINERY: PAN back and forth across i show one spinning gear after another. - Bond looks on helplessly. He reaches forward. - His hands touch a wire, then a spinning disk, trying to it. - The timer drops from "019" to "017." - Bond keeps looking down, then to one side. Meanwhile th smoke of rifle-fire bursts behind him. - His hand touches a turning wheel.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE TO THE VAULT
dialogues.text: THREE SOLDIERS run in bearing rifles, followed by Felix, Johnnie and THREE UNIFORMED OFFICERS.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL
dialogues.text: (shouting) Come on, fellas! Get going! Hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: THE BOMB
dialogues.text: Bond's hands try again to stop the mechanism, without suc

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks down frantically.  142.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: Soldiers and civilians run around a landing and down more stairs.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: glances down at the timer. It descends from "014" to "012

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCIENTIST wearing glasses and a hat rounds the corner, followed by a soldier with a rifle.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: keeps looking down. His hands try again to stop the gears turning. Then he gr some wires. Bond's face registers exertion as he tries to pull the wi apart. The timer drops from "010" to "009."

dialogues.speaker: THE WIRES
dialogues.text: Bond's hands keep pulling them, then suddenly another han reaches in and flips a switch at the side of the machiner The mechanism stops. TILT UP to the scientist. He looks d at the timer.

dialogues.speaker: THE TIMER
dialogues.text: is stopped at "007."

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks over at him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: What kept you?

dialogues.speaker: THE SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: looks up at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: TRACK BACK on Felix as he runs up to Bond with Johnnie an some military officers.  143.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: You okay, James? Where's your butler friend?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks up at Felix.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, he blew a fuse. PAN on Bond as he walks over to Felix.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Three more ticks and Mister Goldfinger would have hit the jackpot. The scientist walks up, shows Felix the primer and walks with it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Did you get him?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Not yet, but he won't get far.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And Pussy?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: She helped us switch the gas in the canisters. By the way, what made her call Washington? DOLLY IN on Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (straight - faced) I must have appealed to her maternal instincts. He looks at Felix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A convoy approaches a plane -- a black convertible, a bla limousine and a white station wagon. The vehicles stop. Felix gets out of the back seat of the convertible, followed by Bond.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: C'mon, James. Get aboard. You can't keep the President waiting. DOLLY with them as they walk to the plane.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Special plane. Lunch at the white House. How come?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: The President wants to thank you personally.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (straightening his cuffs) Oh, it was nothing, really.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I know that, but he doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I suppose I'll be able to get a drink here? They reach the plane.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: I told the stewardess liquor for three.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (looking back at him) Who are the other two?

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Oh, there are no other two. Bond grins. Felix holds his hand out and they shake hands

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Felix.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: So long, James. Good luck. Bond turns to a man in an Army uniform and shakes his han

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Thank you, brigadier. Bond walks up the steps to the plane.

dialogues.speaker: FELIX
dialogues.text: Good luck.  145. Bond looks back.

dialogues.speaker: THE TARMAC
dialogues.text: Felix, Johnnie, the brigadier and other officers wave to

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: salutes them and steps into the fuselage.

dialogues.speaker: THE TARMAC
dialogues.text: Bond's plane taxis away from the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane flies through a cloudy sky. Lettering on the pl says "UNITED STATES."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond, sitting in a swivel chair, undoes his seatbelt and out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond adjusts an overhead air-jet then leans forward again looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: A SET OF CURTAINS TO THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: The curtains suddenly part and Goldfinger steps into the in his military uniform holding his gold revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE CREWMEN struggle with ropes around their arms and l and gags in their mouths.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Bond swivels around -- and sees Goldfinger. His expressio sinks.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: aims his gun at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: I am glad to have you aboard, Mister Bond.  146.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, congratulations on your promotion, Goldfinger.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: He walks closer to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Are you having lunch at the White House, too?

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: In two hours, I shall be in Cuba. And you have interfered with my plans for the last time, Mister Bond. Goldfinger cocks the trigger. Bond looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: It's, uh, very dangerous to fire guns in planes. I even had to warn Pussy about it. Er, by the way, where is she?

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: I will deal with her later.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: At the moment, she is where she ought to be -- at the controls. Goldfinger gestures forward with the gun. Bond suddenly g his arm. He swings Goldfinger around, grabbing for the gu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Goldfinger struggle over the gun.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Goldfinger strikes Bond twice on the neck with the gun. B grabs Goldfinger's arm and pushes him backwards, then Goldfinger turns and flings Bond onto one of the seats.  147.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: punches Goldfinger in the jaw.

dialogues.speaker: GOLDFINGER
dialogues.text: falls backwards. Bond jumps up and hits him in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond hits Goldfinger in the chest again and grabs the arm holding the gun. Goldfinger flings his arms around Bond's torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Goldfinger struggle over the gun. It fires.

dialogues.speaker: A WINDOW IN THE PLANE
dialogues.text: bursts.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONTROLS
dialogues.text: All meters suddenly drop.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Bond hangs onto a rail as Goldfinger is sucked forward.

dialogues.speaker: THE BROKEN WINDOW
dialogues.text: continues to suck air out.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Goldfinger flies head-first toward the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldfinger swivels and the suction pulls him legs-first t the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suction pulls Goldfinger's legs through the window. P over to his screaming face.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: hangs onto the railing, being almost sucked out of the pl himself.  148.

dialogues.speaker: THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Goldfinger is sucked out into space.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Bond continues to hang from the rail as everything not ti down is sucked out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: clutches the rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane dives toward the ground.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Pussy pulls back uselessly on the stick.

dialogues.speaker: AIR PRESSURE GAUGE
dialogues.text: It registers "8" out of "35," then rises a few points.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: falls onto a couch.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Pussy keeps pulling back on the stick.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CABIN
dialogues.text: Bond struggles to his feet and starts moving toward the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three crewmen, still bound and gagged, now lie uncons in f.g. An ARMY OFFICER in the entryway waves outside. Fe and Johnnie run in and all three run toward the crewmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond has almost reached the cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Pussy keeps pulling back on the stick. Bond enters.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Pussy!  149. She looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: What happened? Where's Goldfinger? Bond grabs the co-pilot stick and tries to steer it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Playing his golden harp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It continues to dive.

dialogues.speaker: PUSSY
dialogues.text: It's no good! Bond keeps trying to steady the stick. He looks ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half a dozen men look at a scope, including Felix and Joh

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCOPE
dialogues.text: A glowing dot drops from 8,000 to 5,000 feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It keeps diving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond looks at Pussy. Pussy looks back helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CONTROL TOWER
dialogues.text: The men keep looking at the scope.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCOPE
dialogues.text: The dot is at 4,000 feet, but now another dot appears, dropping to 2,000 feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It dives into the ocean and crashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A helicopter flies overhead.  150.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Felix sits in the passenger seat looking down, the PILOT beside him.

dialogues.speaker: TREES
dialogues.text: They fly over numerous trees, no sign of Bond.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Felix looks ahead, then in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: It continues to pass overhead. Pussy rises and waves her white jacket at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: continues to wave at it. Suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh, no, you don't. He grabs her ankle. She tumbles down into his arm, a parachute behind them.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: This is no time to be rescued. They kiss passionately. Bond grabs the edge of the parach and pulls it over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT UP from the parachute to the helicopter hovering pointlessly above. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: THE END TITLES appear, beginning with:
